                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">S. V. Keeling Memorial Lecture (2016)</h1>
<p class="p">Together with the UCL Greek and Latin, and through the generosity of a private donor, the UCL Philosophy department organises an annual S.V. Keeling Memorial Lecture in Ancient Philosophy.  The 2015-2016 lecture was given by <strong>Professor Susanne Bobzien</strong> (All Souls, Oxford) and was entitled '<strong>Did Frege plagiarize the Stoics?</strong>'</p>


<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>




<p class="p">Prof. Bobzien also ran a Graduate Masterclass on Tuesday 15th March, attended by Graduate Students from UCL, KCL and Royal Holloway University. </p>
<hr class="rule" />
<table class="silvatable list" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  

<h3 class="heading">2016 Lecture</h3>





</td>
<td class="align-left">
  &nbsp;
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td class="align-left">
  <strong>When: 18th March 2016</strong><br />
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  <strong>Where:</strong><br />Gustave Tuck Lecture Theatre<br />Wilkins Building, UCL <br />Gower Street, London WC1E 6BT<br /><a href="http://crf.casa.ucl.ac.uk/screenRoute.aspx?s=386&amp;d=186&amp;w=False" target="_self"><strong>How to get there</strong></a><br />
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="30%" class="align-left" />
<col width="70%" class="align-left" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  <img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/lectures/susan-bobzien" width="200" height="217" alt="susan-bobzien" class="medium-image" title="susan-bobzien" />
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  

<h3 class="heading">Professor Susanne Bobzien </h3>




<p class="p">Susanne Bobzien is professor of philosophy and Senior Research Scholar at All Souls College, Oxford. Before joining Oxford, Professor Bobzien was at Yale University (2002 to 2013). Her research interest include ancient logic and ancient theories of determinism and freedom. She is author of <em>Determinism and Freedom in Stoic Philosophy.</em></p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.asc.ox.ac.uk/person/2155" target="_self">Learn more about Prof. Bobzien</a></li>
</ul>

</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

                                      Most likely causes:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>There might be a typing error in the address.</li>
                                          <li>If you clicked on a link, it may be out of date.</li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      What you can try:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>

                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      More information:
                                    </h4>
                                    <p class="p">
                                        This error (<acronym title="Hypertext Transfer Protocol">HTTP</acronym> 404 Not Found) means that you have connected to the UCL Website, but the page you wanted was not found. It's possible that the webpage is temporarily unavailable. Alternatively, the UCL Website might have changed or removed the webpage.

            Modernizr.load({
                //cutting the mustard as used by the BBC
                test : cuttingTheMustard
                //if old browser load the shiv
                ,nope : [
                    '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/html5shiv-printshiv.min.js'
                    ,'//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/respond.min.js'
                    ,'//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/respond.proxy.min.js'
                ]
            });
            //set conditional assets for main.js
            var globalSiteSpecificVars = {
                pathToJquery: '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/jquery-1.9.1.min'
                ,googleAnalyticsIdsArray: []//specify array of site specific id's NOT UCL generic UA-943297-1
            }
            if(cuttingTheMustard){
                globalSiteSpecificVars.pathToJquery = '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/jquery-2.1.1.min';
            }
        </script> 

        <script src="//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/require.min.js"></script>
        <script src='//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/skins/UCLIndigoSkin/default-theme/main.js'></script>
        <script>require(['app/general','theme/indigo-autocomplete-ga','theme/silva','app/searchWithAutoComplete','app/lightbox',]);//load the default stuff</script>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">S.V. Keeling Memorial Lecture (2014)</h1>
<p class="p">Together with the UCL Greek and Latin, and through the generosity of a private donor, the UCL Philosophy department organises an annual S.V. Keeling Memorial Lecture in Ancient Philosophy. The lecture in 2014 was given by <strong>Prof. Gail Fine</strong> and was entitled '<strong>Knowledge, Belief and Perception in the <em>Phaedo</em></strong>'</p>
<hr class="rule" />


<h3 class="heading">2014 Lecture</h3>




<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>
<table class="silvatable list" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  <p class="p"><strong>Held on: </strong></p>
<p class="p"><strong>12 March 2014</strong><br />4pm-6pm<br /><br /></p>

</td>
<td class="align-left">
  <p class="p"><strong>Held at:</strong></p>
<p class="p">Gustave Tuck Lecture Theatre <br />Wilkins Building, UCL <br />Gower Street, London WC1E 6BT<br /></p>

</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"> </h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>







<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading">S.V. Keeling Masterclass: 11 March 2014 </h3>




<p class="p"><strong>Knowledge and Belief in <em>Republic</em> 5 </strong></p>
<p class="p">Professor Fine also ran a Masterclass for Graduate students entitled 'Knowledge and Belief in <em>Republic</em> 5.', held at the Department of Philosophy on 11 March 2014.</p>


<h3 class="heading"> Prof. Gail Fine</h3>




<img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/lectures/Gfine" width="200" height="154" alt="Gfine" class="medium-image float-left" title="Gfine" /><p class="p">Prof. Fine is visiting Professor of Ancient Philosophy at Merton College, Oxford. Her books include:</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><em>On Ideas: Aristotle’s Criticism of Plato’s Theory of Forms</em> (OUP, 1993)
</li>
<li><em>Plato on Knowledge and Forms: Selected Essays</em> (OUP, 2003)</li>
<li><em>The Possibility of Inquiry: Meno’s Paradox from Socrates to Sextus</em> (OUP, 2014).</li>
</ul>
<hr class="rule" />

<h2 class="heading"></h2>







<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>




<p class="p"><strong></strong></p>

<h2 class="heading"> </h2>





<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>
<table class="silvatable list" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">S.V. Keeling Memorial Lecture (2015)</h1>
<p class="p"><abbr title="Keeling Lecture"></abbr>Together with the UCL Greek and Latin, and through the generosity of a private donor, the UCL Philosophy department organises an annual S.V. Keeling Memorial Lecture in Ancient Philosophy.  The 2014-2015 lecture was given by <strong>Professor David Sedley </strong>and was entitled<strong> 'Socrates' Second Voyage (Plato, <em>Phaedo, </em>99-101)'</strong></p>
<hr class="rule" />
<p class="p"><strong><br /></strong></p>


<h3 class="heading">2015 Lecture</h3>




<table class="silvatable list" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  <p class="p"><strong>Held: 13 May 2015</strong><br />5pm-7pm<strong><br /></strong></p>
<p class="p">With a prior reception held in the JZ Young Lecture Theater Foyer</p>

</td>
<td class="align-left">
  <strong>Held at:</strong><br />JZ Young Lecture Theatre in the Anatomy Building.<strong><br /></strong>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p class="p"><strong><br /></strong></p>


<h3 class="heading">S.V.Keeling Masterclass: 12 May 2015</h3>




<p class="p">Associated with the lecture was a Masterclass for Graduate students led by Prof. Sedley on 12 May 2015. </p>


<h3 class="heading">Professor David Sedley</h3>




<div class="medium-image      image-left"><img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/lectures/David_Sedley" width="200" height="133" alt="david sedley" class="medium-image      image-left" title="david sedley" /></div><p class="p">Prof. Sedley is Laurence Professor of Ancient Philosophy Fellow of Christ's College, Cambridge. </p>
<p class="p">His books include: </p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><em>The Hellenistic Philosophers</em> (with <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A._A._Long">A. A. Long</a>), Cambridge 1987</li>
<li><em>Lucretius and the Transformation of Greek Wisdom</em>, Cambridge 1998</li>
<li><em>The Cambridge Companion to Greek and Roman Philosophy</em>, Cambridge 2003</li>
<li><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plato"><em>Plato's</em></a> <em><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cratylus">Cratylus</a></em>, Cambridge 2003</li>
<li><em>The Midwife of Platonism. Text and Subtext in Plato's</em> <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theaetetus_(dialogue)"><em>Theaetetus</em></a>, Oxford 2004</li>
<li><em>Creationism and its Critics in Antiquity</em>, Berkeley and Los Angeles 2007</li>
<li><em>Pyrrhonists, Patricians, Platonizers. Hellenistic Philosophy in the Period 155-86 BC</em> (edited with A. M. Ioppolo), Naples, 2007</li>
</ul>


<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>




<br><br>


<h3 class="heading"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/lectures/Keeling_Lecture">Official Poster for S.V.Keeling Lecture and Masterclass 2014</a></h3>





<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>

</table>

<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>

<tbody>
<tr class="odd">

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

</tbody>

<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

<footer class="footer wrapper"> 
    <div class="footer__inner clearfix">
        


        


        



        <article class="block block--col-1">
            <h2 class="as-h5">UCL facilities</h2>
            <ul class="footer__list list-unstyled">
                <li class="footer__item"><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/departments/faculties">Faculties and departments</a></li>
                <li class="footer__item"><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/library/">Library</a></li>
                <li class="footer__item"><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/museums">Museums and Collections</a></li>
                <li class="footer__item"><a href="//www.thebloomsbury.com/">UCL Bloomsbury Theatre</a></li>
            </ul>
        </article>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Past Lectures</h1>
<p class="p">Most of the first ten lectures have been published in <em>Modern Thinkers and Ancient Thinkers</em>, edited by R. W. Sharples (London: UCL Press, 1993). Most of the second ten lectures have been published in <em>Perspectives on Greek Philosophy</em>, edited by R. W. Sharples (Aldershot: Ashgate, 2003). Below you will find a list of all previous Keeling lectures.</p>
<hr class="rule" />
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>
<table class="silvatable list" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="33%" class="align-left" />
<col width="66%" class="align-left" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  
<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading">2016</h2>






</td>
<td class="align-left">
  &nbsp;
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td class="align-left">
   18 March 2016<br /><br />
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/lectures/2016lecture">Prof. Susanne Bobzien - Did Frege Plagarize the Stoics?</a>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  
<h2 class="heading">2011 - 2015</h2>






</td>
<td class="align-left">
  &nbsp;
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td class="align-left">
  13 May 2015
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/lectures/keeling-lecture2015" target="_self">Prof. David Sedley - 'Socrates' Second Voyage (Plato, <em>Phaedo </em>99-101)'</a>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
   <br />12 March 2014<br /><br />
</td>
<td class="align-left">
   <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/lectures/current-lecture" target="_self">Prof. Gail Fine - 'Knowledge, Belief and Perception in the Phaedo'</a>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td class="align-left">
  10 October 2012
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  Richard Sorabji - 'The Origins of the Idea of Moral Conscience, and Subsequent Consequences'
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  15 March 2012 
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  Lesley
Brown - 'Agreement and Truth in Plato'
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td class="align-left">
  9 March 2011 
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  Malcolm Schofield - 'Philosophy as Debate, Philosophy as Guidance: Cicero's Ethical Writings''
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  
<h2 class="heading">2001 - 2010</h2>






</td>
<td class="align-left">
  &nbsp;
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td class="align-left">
  18 March 2010 
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  Victor Caston - 'The Veil of
Perception' 
</td>
</tr>

                                  <div class="info">
                                    <h2 class="heading">The resource cannot be found</h2>
                                    <p class="p">
                                      <acronym title="Uniform Resource Locator">URL</acronym>:
                                      http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/lectures
                                      <br /><br />
                                    </p>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      Most likely causes:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>There might be a typing error in the address.</li>
                                          <li>If you clicked on a link, it may be out of date.</li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      What you can try:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>Retype the address.</li>
                                          <li>Use the search box above to find what you're looking for.</li>
                                          <li>Go to <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk" title="UCL Website">www.ucl.ac.uk</a> and look for the information you want.</li>
                                          <li><a href="javascript:history.back()" title="Back to previous page">Go back to the previous page.</a></li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      More information:
                                    </h4>
                                    <p class="p">
                                        This error (<acronym title="Hypertext Transfer Protocol">HTTP</acronym> 404 Not Found) means that you have connected to the UCL Website, but the page you wanted was not found. It's possible that the webpage is temporarily unavailable. Alternatively, the UCL Website might have changed or removed the webpage. 
                                    </p>
                                  </div>

  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;

    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Prospective Students</h1>
<p class="p">All major areas of philosophy are available for study at UCL, covering branches such as political thought, epistemology and metaphysics, and also drawing upon the writings of philosophers both ancient and modern to place your studies in context.</p>
<!-- Subtemplate: 3 columns with 33/33/33 divisions -->  
<section class="threecolumns">
  
  <section class="threecolumns__column1"> 
    
<p class="clearfix">
 <a href="/philosophy/prospective-students/undergraduate"
    class="cta btn pull-left"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','CTA','Click','/philosophy/prospective-students/undergraduate'])">

   Undergraduate

 </a>
</p>

<h2 class="heading"></h2>





<p class="p"><strong></strong></p>


  </section> 

<section class="threecolumns__column2"> 
    
<p class="clearfix">
 <a href="/philosophy/prospective-students/graduate-taught"
    class="cta btn pull-left"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','CTA','Click','/philosophy/prospective-students/graduate-taught'])">

   Graduate (Taught)

 </a>
</p>
<p class="p"><br /><strong></strong></p>


  </section> 
 
 <section class="threecolumns__column3">

   Graduate (Research)

 </a>
</p>

  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";

    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                        <article class="article clearfix">

<h1 class="heading">Careers &amp; Destinations</h1>

<h2 class="heading">Resources at UCL</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/careers" target="_self">Careers</a></li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">Beyond UCL</h2>





<p class="p">UCL Philosophy graduates often go on to undertake careers in law, computing, academia, public administration, publishing,
and writing or journalism. <br /></p>
<p class="p">It is notable that many of our graduates work for
publicly funded bodies, and many others in relatively small organisations. Others have joined the police, started
their own business, or undertaken further study.</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/careers/departments/careers_with_a_philosophy_degree" target="_self">Learn more about careers with a Philosophy degree</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/alumni/phd-placement-record" target="_self">See our full PhD placement record</a></li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">Selected Destinations</h2>

<h2 class="heading">Alumni in the Public Eye</h2>





<a class="image" href="http://www.rickygervais.com/" title="Ricky Gervais" target="_blank"><img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/images/RickyGervais.png" width="143" height="182" alt="Ricky Gervais" class="no-respond float-left" title="Ricky Gervais" /></a><p class="p"><a href="http://www.rickygervais.com/" target="_self">Ricky Gervais</a>  (Philosophy BA, 1983)</p>
<p class="p">Comedian, actor, director, producer, musician, writer, and former radio presenter. He received widespread success and critical acclaim with the TV series 'The Office' and has since gone one to appear in Hollywood movies including 'Cemetry Junction', 'Ghost Town' and 'The Invention of Lying'.</p>
<hr class="rule" />
<a class="image" href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b006qgvj/presenters/jonathan-dimbleby" title="Jonathan Dimbleby" target="_blank"><img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/images/Jonathan_Dimbleby.png" width="143" height="182" alt="Jonathan Dimbleby" class="no-respond float-left" title="Jonathan Dimbleby" /></a><p class="p"><a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b006qgvj/presenters/jonathan-dimbleby" target="_self">Johnathan Dimbleby</a> (Philosophy BA, 1969)</p>
<p class="p">Chair of BBC Radio 4's Any Questions? since 1987, Johnathan Dimbleby is also a past President of the Soil Association and CPRE. He is currently President of the VSO (since 1997) and chairman of Index on Censorship (since 2008). He is also a trustee of Dimbleby Cancer Care.<br /></p>
<hr class="rule" />
<a class="image" href="http://www.petercave.com/" title="Peter Cave" target="_blank"><img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/images/Peter_Cave.png" width="143" height="182" alt="Peter Cave" class="no-respond float-left" title="Peter Cave" /></a><p class="p"><a href="http://www.petercave.com/" target="_self">Peter Cave</a><strong> </strong>(Philosophy BA, 1972)</p>
<p class="p">Author of a number of books including 'This Sentence is False', 'Can A Robot Be Human?', 'What's Wrong With Eating People?', 'Humanism: A Beginner's Guide', 'Do Llamas Fall in Love?' and 'Philosophy'. He has also appeared on BBC Radio 4.</p>
<hr class="rule" />
<a class="image" href="http://ken-follett.com/" title="Ken Follett" target="_blank"><img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/images/Ken_Follett.png" width="143" height="182" alt="Ken Follett" class="no-respond float-left" title="Ken Follett" /></a><p class="p"><a href="http://ken-follett.com/" target="_self">Ken Follett</a><strong> </strong>(Philosophy BA, 1970)</p>
<p class="p">Author Ken Follett has sold over 100 million copies of his books worldwide. Four of his works have reached the number one spot on the New York Times best-seller list - 'The Key to Rebecca', 'Lie Down with Lions', 'Triple' and 'World Without End'.</p>
<hr class="rule" />
<a class="image" href="http://www.noreena.com/" title="Noreena Hertz" target="_blank"><img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/images/Noreena_Hertz.png" width="143" height="182" alt="Noreena Hertz" class="no-respond float-left" title="Noreena Hertz" /></a><p class="p"><a href="http://www.noreena.com/" target="_self">Noreena Hertz</a><strong> </strong>(Philosophy &amp; Economics BA, 1987)<br />An economist, author and campaigner, Noreena Hertz has previously been listed as one of the Guardian's Top 101 Female Public Intellectuals. Her 2002 book 'The Silent Takeover' famously warned that unregulated markets, corporate greed, and over-powerful financial institutions would have serious global consequences.</p>
<hr class="rule" />
<a class="image" href="http://shahrarali.net/" title="Sharar Ali" target="_blank"><img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/images/Shahrar_Ali.png" width="143" height="182" alt="Sharar Ali" class="no-respond float-left" title="Sharar Ali" /></a><p class="p"><a href="http://shahrarali.net/" target="_self">Shahrar Ali</a><strong> </strong>(PhD, 2004) </p>
<p class="p">Now working in green politics, Dr Shahrar Ali has formerly worked as a researcher in the European Parliament on the risks of GM food. He is an officer of London Green Party. His PhD focused on examining lying and deception, with specific reference to public life.</p>

<h2 class="heading">Other Notable Alumni</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li> <a href="http://www.dhkerby.com/" target="_self">D H Kerby</a> (Study Abroad at UCL Student, 1985)</li>
<li> <a href="http://www.microphilosophy.net/" target="_self">Julian Baggini</a> (PhD, 1996)</li>
<li> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dimitris_Lyacos" target="_self">Dimitris Lyacos</a> (Philosophy MA, 1993)</li>
<li> <a href="http://www.dianajanney.com/" target="_self">Diana Janney </a>(Philosophy BA - 1991, MA - 1992)</li>
<li> <a href="http://www.philosophy-foundation.org/home" target="_self">Peter Worley </a>(Philosophy BA, 2000)</li>
</ul>
<p class="p"><strong><br /></strong> </p>

                        <article class="article clearfix">

<h1 class="heading">Graduate (Research)</h1>
<!-- Subtemplate: 2 columns with 50/50 division -->  
<section class="middle-split"> 

  <section class="middle-split__column1"> 
    
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/graduate-research/philosophical-studies-mphil-stud" target="_self">Philosophical Studies MPhil Stud</a>
</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/graduate-research/phd" target="_self">PhD</a></li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">London Arts &amp; Humanities Partnership (LAHP)</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.lahp.ac.uk/" target="_self">AHRC-funded postgraduate research studentships</a></li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">Resources</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/why-ucl-philosophy" target="_self">Why study at UCL?</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/alumni/phd-placement-record" target="_self">Full PhD Placement Record</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/student-testimonials" target="_self">Student testimonials</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/study-abroad-at-ucl" target="_self">Study Abroad at UCL</a></li>
</ul>

 <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/research/application/"
    class="cta btn cta-half pull-left"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','CTA','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/research/application/'])">

   How to apply

 </a>
</p>


  </section>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">PhD</h1>
<p class="p">The doctoral programme at UCL provides students with the opportunity to conduct original research in philosophy in one of UK's top philosophy departments, under the supervision of prominent academics in the field. The PhD programme is designed to prepare students for an academic career, whether it be via the three-year (minimum) MPhil/PhD or the two-year (minimum) PhD following on from the MPhil Stud or equivalent, by ensuring that students receive grounding across a range of topics as well as producing a research thesis.</p>






<div id="accordion">

<dl class="accordion">
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Key Information</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>            var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                                var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-research-degrees';</script>
        


            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        

                        

                        
                            
       
            <section id="key-information" class="copy__section copy__section--key__information">
                <div class="island island--highlight island--subtle-highlight clearfix">
                    <h3 class="copy__heading">Key Information</h3>
                    <section class="threecolumns">
                        
                            
                                <div class="clearfix">
                                    <h5>Programme starts</h5>
                                    <p>September 2018</p>
                                </div>
                            

                            <section style="border-width:0"
    class="threecolumns__column1">
                                <h5>Modes and duration</h5>
                                <div>
                                    <strong>Full time:</strong>
                                    3 years
                                </div>
                                <div>
                                    <strong>Part time:</strong>
                                    5 years
                                </div>
                                
                                
                                
                            </section>
                        

                        
                            <section style="border-width:0"
    class="threecolumns__column2">
                                <h5>Tuition Fees (2018/19)</h5>
                                <dl class="list--defined">
                                    
                                        <dt>UK/EU:</dt>
                                        <dd>
                                            
                                                <span>
                                                    &#163;5060 (FT)
                                                </span>
                                            
                                           
                                                <span>
                                                    &#163;2530 (PT)
                                                </span>
                                            
                                        </dd>
                                    
                                    
                                        <dt>Overseas:</dt>
                                        <dd>
                                            
                                                <span>
                                                    &#163;19580 (FT)
                                                </span>
                                            
                                            
                                                <span>
                                                    &#163;9850 (PT)
                                                </span>
                                            
                                        </dd>
                                    
                                </dl>
                            </section>
                        

                        
                            <section style="border-width:0"
    class="threecolumns__column3">
                                <h5>Application dates</h5>
                                <div>
                                    <div><strong>All applicants</strong></div>
                                    
                                    <div>Close: 3 January 2018</div>
                                </div>
                                
                                
                                
                                
                            </section>
                        
                    </section>

                    <div>
                        <p>
                            <b>Note on fees:</b>
                            The tuition fees shown are for the year indicated above. Fees for subsequent years may increase or otherwise vary. Further information on fee status, fee increases and the fee schedule can be viewed on the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/students/fees">UCL Current Students website</a>.
                            
                        </p>
                    </div>

                    

                    <div>
                        
                        <div>
                            <strong>Location:</strong> London, Bloomsbury
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    <hr class="clearfix">
                    <div class="middle-split clearfix">
                        <section>
                            
                                <h5>Entry Requirements</h5>
                                <p>The usual prerequisite for the MPhil/PhD is a one-year research degree in Philosophy or an overseas qualification of an equivalent standard. Direct admission to the PhD requires the MPhil Stud (or equivalent). All applicants for research degrees must submit two short pieces of work, of about 2,000 words each, with their application.</p>
                            
                            <h5>English Language Requirements</h5>
                            <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency.</p>
                            <p>The English language level for this programme is: <strong>Good</strong></p>
                            <p>Further information can be found on our <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/life/international/english-requirements">English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                        </section>
                        <section>
                            <h5>International students</h5>
                            <p>Country-specific information, including details of when UCL representatives are visiting your part of the world, can be obtained from the <a class="clicktracker international" href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/international">International Students website</a>.</p>
                            
                            <p>International applicants can find out the equivalent qualification for their country by selecting from the list below.</p>
                            <p>Select your country:

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Structure</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p">The MPhil/PhD in Philosophy at UCL is a three year (minimum) research programme. It requires students to take graduate courses assessed by way of several papers in their first year, and, provided successful upgrade to the PhD, to produce a thesis of original research under the guidance of their supervisor(s). The PhD degree is awarded on the basis of a thesis of approximately 75,000 (not more than 80,000) words. The candidate is also given a viva voce examination. </p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Funding</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>            var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                                var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-research-degrees';</script>
        


            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        

                        

                        
                            
       
            <section id="key-information" class="copy__section copy__section--key__information">
                <div class="island island--highlight island--subtle-highlight clearfix">
                    <h3 class="copy__heading">Key Information</h3>
                    <section class="threecolumns">
                        

                        

                        
                    </section>

                    <div>
                        <p>
                            <b>Note on fees:</b>
                            The tuition fees shown are for the year indicated above. Fees for subsequent years may increase or otherwise vary. Further information on fee status, fee increases and the fee schedule can be viewed on the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/students/fees">UCL Current Students website</a>.
                            
                        </p>
                    </div>

                    

                    <div>
                        
                        <div>
                            <strong>Location:</strong> London, Bloomsbury
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    
                    
                </div>
            </section>
        
    
                        


                        


                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__section--funding collapse">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Funding</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <p><p>MPhil/PhD and PhD candidates will be considered for AHRC funding through the LAHP (London Arts &amp; Humanities Partnership), whose members are UCL, King's College London, and the School of Advanced Study at the University of London. Other scholarships and sources of funding may be available; please check the UCL Scholarships and Funding website. You should take note of funding application deadlines as these can differ from programme application deadlines.</p></p>
                                    <p><p>The department has a set of funds to offer awards to research students which are allocated on the basis of merit and need. These include the Follett Scholarship (1-year award of &pound;13,000); the Jacobsen Scholarship (1-year award of &pound;9,000) and one or two S V Keeling Scholarships in ancient philosophy (covering UK/EU fees and maintenance matching AHRC funding). Some smaller department awards are also listed below.</p></p>

                                    

                                    <!-- scholarships listed here -->
                                    
                                    <p>For a comprehensive list of the funding opportunities available at UCL, including funding relevant to your nationality, please visit the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships">Scholarships and Funding website</a>.</p>
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        
    
       
                        
    

                        


                        
                        
                        
    
                        

                        

                        

                        
                    </div>

                    

                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Careers</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>            var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                                var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-research-degrees';</script>
        


            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        

                        

                        
                            
       
            <section id="key-information" class="copy__section copy__section--key__information">
                <div class="island island--highlight island--subtle-highlight clearfix">
                    <h3 class="copy__heading">Key Information</h3>
                    <section class="threecolumns">
                        

                        

                        
                    </section>

                    <div>
                        <p>
                            <b>Note on fees:</b>
                            The tuition fees shown are for the year indicated above. Fees for subsequent years may increase or otherwise vary. Further information on fee status, fee increases and the fee schedule can be viewed on the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/students/fees">UCL Current Students website</a>.
                            
                        </p>
                    </div>

                    

                    <div>
                        
                        <div>
                            <strong>Location:</strong> London, Bloomsbury
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    
                    
                </div>
            </section>
        
    
                        


                        


                        
    
       
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__section--careers collapse">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Careers</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <p><p>Recent graduates with a PhD in philosophy from UCL have gained prestigious academic fellowships as well as postdoctoral placements in the UK and elsewhere in Europe (for example at the University of Oxford, the University of London, University of Cambridge, Sheffield University, University of Antwerp, and the Institute of Philosophy, UNAM, Mexico). Others have gone on to lectureships in the UK (for example at the University of Oxford, University of York, LSE) and overseas at the University of Cape Town and the University of Melbourne. <br/><br/>
Those who have not pursued an academic career have entered a variety of professions, including law, public policy, and publishing.</p></p>

                                    
                                    <div class="clearfix">

                                        <div
    class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
                                            <h5>Recent career destinations for this degree</h5>
                                            <ul>
                                                
                                                    <li>Associate Researcher, Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México (UNAM) (National Aut</li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li>Lecturer - Philosophy, University of Cape Town</li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li>The Robin Geffen Research Fellow and Tutor in Philosophy, University of Oxford</li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li>Post-Doc Researcher, University of Antwerp and studying Post-Doc Philosophy, University of Antwerp</li>
                                                
                                            </ul>
                                        </div>
                                        <div
    class="copy__column dc3-dc4">
                                            <h5>Employability</h5>
                                            <p><p>The department has an outstanding job placement record in a highly competitive academic market. The most successful candidates in this market are valued for their range of teaching competence, provided for by the taught elements of the MPhil/PhD programme, as well as for their particular area of specialisation, determined by the research topic of the doctoral thesis.
<br/><br/>
During the course of the programme, students receive training in presentational skills, interview practice and teaching methods, and are encouraged to present their research at the department's Work in Progress seminars, and at graduate and academic conferences in the UK and overseas.</p></p>
                                        </div>
                                    </div>

                                     <div class="clearfix">

                                        <div
    class="copy__column">
                                            <h5>Networking</h5>
                                            <p><p>The department has links with US universities (Berkeley, Columbia and Yale). Academic staff are involved in the running of the Aristotelian Society, the main philosophy society in the UK. Others are involved in running the Institute of Classical Studies lecture series, and the Keeling Colloquia and Lectures in ancient philosophy. Philosophy graduate students host a philosophy conference at the start of every year, and co-organise an annual graduate philosophy conference with graduate students at Berkeley. Finally, the Royal Institute of Philosophy lecture series, co-ordinated by the Institute of Philosophy at Senate House, is open to our graduate students.</p></p>
                                        </div>
                                    </div>

                                    <div class="clearfix">

                                        <div
    class="copy__column">
                                            <p
    class="small text-muted">Careers data is taken from the ‘Destinations of Leavers from Higher Education’ survey undertaken by HESA looking at the destinations of UK and EU students in the 2012–2014 graduating cohorts six months after graduation.</p>
                                        </div>
                                    </div>
                               </div>
                            </section>
                        
    

                        


                        
                        
                        
    
                        

                        

                        

                        
                    </div>

                    

                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Application and next steps</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>            var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                                var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-research-degrees';</script>
        


            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        

                        

                        
                            
       
            <section id="key-information" class="copy__section copy__section--key__information">
                <div class="island island--highlight island--subtle-highlight clearfix">
                    <h3 class="copy__heading">Key Information</h3>
                    <section class="threecolumns">
                        

                        

                        
                    </section>

                    <div>
                        <p>
                            <b>Note on fees:</b>
                            The tuition fees shown are for the year indicated above. Fees for subsequent years may increase or otherwise vary. Further information on fee status, fee increases and the fee schedule can be viewed on the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/students/fees">UCL Current Students website</a>.
                            
                        </p>
                    </div>

                    

                    <div>
                        
                        <div>
                            <strong>Location:</strong> London, Bloomsbury
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    
                    
                </div>
            </section>
        
    
                        


                        


                        
    
       
                        
    

                        


                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__section--application collapse">
                                <h3 id="application" class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                        <h4>Applications</h4>
                                        <p>Students are advised to apply as early as possible due to competition for places. Those applying for scholarship funding (particularly overseas applicants) should take note of application deadlines.</p>
                                        
                                        <div class="clearfix">
                                            <div
    class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
                                                
                                                <div>
                                                    <h5>Application deadlines</h5>
                                                    <dl class="list--defined">
                                                        
                                                            <dt>All applicants</dt>
                                                            <dd>3 January 2018</dd>
                                                        
                                                        
                                                        
                                                    </dl>
                                                    
                                                    <p><p>The MPhil/PhD and PhD start date is September each year. For 2017 entry, applications open in October 2016, and are due by January 3 2017. Please attach two samples of your written work (2000 words each). For more information see our How to apply page.</p></p>
                                                    
                                                </div>
                                                
                                                    <br><p>For more information see our <a
    href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply">Applications</a> page.</p>
                                                    <a
    class="cta btn prospectus"
    href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply">Apply now</a>
                                                
                                            </div>
                                            
                                        </div>
                                    

                                    
                                    <div class="clearfix">
                                        <ul class="unset-list">
                                            <li>
                                            <span class="icon icon-online" aria-hidden="true"></span>
                                            <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy"
    class="clicktracker departmentresearch">Philosophy</a>
                                            </li>
                                        </ul>
                                    </div>
                                </div>
                            </section>        
                        
                        
                        
    
                        

                        

                        

                        
                    </div>

                    

                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Entry Level</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p"> The normal route to PhD study in the department is by way of undertaking the two-year MPhil Stud initially. Students who have completed the MPhil Stud (or an equivalent) will have gained sufficient depth and breadth of knowledge to progress to the two-year (minimum) PhD. </p>
<p class="p">There is a provision for those who have sufficient graduate training in Philosophy to be admitted to the three-year MPhil/ PhD programme. If an offer is made the graduate committee who review applications will make this at the appropriate entry level (MPhil Stud, MPhil/PhD or PhD) depending on your previous studies. </p>
<p class="p">It is therefore important to include as full transcripts as possible so an appropriate offer is made.</p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Important Information about Writing Samples</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<ul class="disc">
<li>Writing samples are a crucial piece of our admissions process for the MPhil Stud.</li>
<li>We ask for <strong>two</strong> pieces around <strong>2000 words </strong>each (excluding bibliography). </li>
<li>The short length is because we deal with so many applications.</li>
<li>We ask for two as we do not want to make the decision on seeing only one piece of work.</li>
<li>If you send in longer pieces we cannot guarantee they will be read in their entirety.</li>
<li>Longer pieces with highlighted sections can be submitted although we would caution against this as it is not always possible to get a feel for an argument from a section. </li>
<li>Remember you are in competition with many other applicants so it is worth taking some time to work on a piece that fulfils the requirements.</li>
</ul>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Programme contacts</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>

<h2 class="heading">Contact Information</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li>Mr Richard Edwards</li>
<li><a href="mailto:philosophy@ucl.ac.uk">philosophy@ucl.ac.uk</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/graduate-research/philosophical-studies-mphil-stud/accordion/tel:+44%20%280%2920%207679%207115">+44 (0)20 7679 7115</a></li>
</ul>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy">Philosophy</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.google.co.uk/maps/place/University+College+London/@51.5244151,-0.1337821,17z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x48761b2f69173579:0xd008c67faecc133e" target="_self">UCL UK Campus</a></li>
</ul>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Department Scholarships</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p">There is a list of department scholarships of the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships/graduate/deptscholarships/philosophy" target="_self">UCL funding pages</a>.</p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
</dl>
 

</div>




<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                                        <hr />

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Philosophical Studies MPhil Stud</h1>
<p class="p">The MPhil Stud in Philosophy at UCL is one of the pre-eminent research Master's in philosophy in the UK. Over a period of two years students complete coursework across a specified range of areas, and produce a substantial research thesis. Students who have completed the MPhil Stud will have gained sufficient depth and breadth of knowledge to progress to the PhD. </p>






<div id="accordion">

<dl class="accordion">
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Key Information</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>

                                    <p>September 2018</p>
                                </div>

    class="threecolumns__column1">

                                    2 years

                            </section>

                    <div>
                        <p>
                            <b>Note on fees:</b>
                            The tuition fees shown are for the year indicated above. Fees for subsequent years may increase or otherwise vary. Further information on fee status, fee increases and the fee schedule can be viewed on the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/students/fees">UCL Current Students website</a>.
                            
                        </p>
                    </div>

                    

                    <div>
                        
                        <div>
                            <strong>Location:</strong> London, Bloomsbury
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    <hr class="clearfix">
                    <div class="middle-split clearfix">
                        <section>
                            
                                <h5>Entry Requirements</h5>
                                <p>A first-class UK Bachelor's degree in Philosophy or an overseas qualification of an equivalent standard. All applicants for research degrees must submit two short pieces of work, of about 2,000 words each, with their application.</p>
                            
                            <h5>English Language Requirements</h5>
                            <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency.</p>
                            <p>The English language level for this programme is: <strong>Good</strong></p>
                            <p>Further information can be found on our <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/life/international/english-requirements">English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                        </section>
                        <section>
                            <h5>International students</h5>
                            <p>Country-specific information, including details of when UCL representatives are visiting your part of the world, can be obtained from the <a class="clicktracker international" href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/international">International Students website</a>.</p>
                            
                            <p>International applicants can find out the equivalent qualification for their country by selecting from the list below.</p>

  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Degree Information</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>

<h2 class="heading">Structure</h2>






<h2 class="heading">Year One</h2>





<p class="p">In their first year, students take the following three  compulsory courses (worth 15 credits each):</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li> <strong>Recent Philosophical Writings</strong></li>
</ul>
<p class="p">A three-term 
fortnightly  seminar for all research students, run by two members of 
staff. This seminar  focuses on the recent philosophical literature. 
Students give presentations and  it is expected that each MPhil Stud 
student will give a senior seminar  presentation during their two years 
on the course.</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li> <strong>Practical Criticism I</strong></li>
</ul>
<p class="p">Close reading of a classic  philosophical text, for first year MPhil Stud students only (Term 1). </p>
<ul class="disc">
<li> <strong>Practical Criticism II</strong></li>
</ul>
<p class="p">Close reading of a classic  philosophical text, for first year MPhil Stud students only (Term 2).</p>
<p class="p">In addition, students must take seven optional 
courses (worth 15 credits each), usually distributed as follows:</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li>Term 1 (three courses)</li>
<li>Term 2 (three courses)</li>
<li>Term 3 (one course)</li>
</ul>
<p class="p">These courses  can either be MPhil Stud  courses covering some region of philosophy in
 depth, or Research Seminars in  which faculty members present their 
latest research.</p>
<p class="p">In the third term,  students work on their 
dissertation with their supervisor.</p>

<h2 class="heading">Year Two</h2>





<p class="p">
In their second year, students must take the following two compulsory courses:</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li> <strong>Recent Philosophical Writings</strong></li>
</ul>
<p class="p">A three-term 
fortnightly  seminar for all research students focusing on recent philosophical literature and run by two members of 
staff.<br /></p>
<p class="p">Students give presentations and  it is expected that each MPhil Stud 
student will give a senior seminar  presentation during their two years 
on the course. (15 credits)</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li> <strong>Thesis Preparation</strong></li>
</ul>
<p class="p">A weekly seminar in which students  present work in progress from their theses (30 credits).</p>
<p class="p"> In addition, students must take three optional courses in 
Term 1 (worth 15 credits each). In their second term, students receive 
individual 
 supervision on their thesis project, and the third term is spent 
entirely  working on the thesis.</p>

<h2 class="heading">Rules governing choice of optional courses:</h2>





<p class="p">Students must take SEVEN optional courses in their first  year, and 
THREE in their second year.</p>
<p class="p">Students’ choices among optional courses  
are constrained as follows:</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li> They must take at least SIX dedicated graduate courses over the two years.</li>
<li> They must take at least TWO courses from each of categories A, B and C. </li>
</ul>
<p class="p"> The A, B and C lists correspond to a rough division of philosophical 
topics into: <br /></p>
<ul class="disc">
<li>A - 'Theoretical' (epistemology, metaphysics, philosophy 
of mind and language,  logic etc.)</li>
<li>B - 'Practical' (in the Kantian 
sense) and/or 'evaluative'/'normative' (ethics, political philosophy, 
aesthetics) </li>
<li>C - History  of philosophy.</li>
</ul>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Funding</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p"> The department has a set of funds to offer awards to research 
students which are allocated on the basis of merit and need. These 
include the Follett Scholarship, a one-year award of £13,000; the S V 
Keeling Scholarship, a three-year scholarship to support research in 
philosophy, principally in ancient philosophy, worth £7,500 per year; 
Ayer, Dawes Hicks, Jacobsen, Melhuish, J S Mill Scholarships, each worth
 £500–£1,000.</p>
<p class="p"> For a comprehensive list of the funding 
opportunities available at UCL, including funding relevant to your 
nationality, please visit the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships">Scholarships and Funding website</a>.</p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Careers</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p">Recent graduates have gained prestigious 
fellowships as well as postdoctoral placements in the UK and elsewhere 
in Europe. Others have gone on to lectureships in the UK.</p>


<h3 class="heading">Employability</h3>




<p class="p">The breadth and quantity of 
pre-doctoral graduate-level modules required by the UCL MPhil Stud 
programme is unmatched by any other UK Philosophy department, ensuring 
that our research students enter specialist doctoral work with a deep 
general understanding of the discipline.<br /><br />
The department has an outstanding job placement record in a highly 
competitive market that values a range of areas of teaching competence 
in addition to an area of specialisation. Students also receive training
 in transferable presentational skills, interview practice and teaching 
methods.</p>


<h3 class="heading">Networking</h3>




<p class="p">The department has links with US 
universities (Berkeley, Columbia and Yale). Academic staff are involved 
in the running of the Aristotelian Society, which is the main philosophy
 society in the UK.</p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Why study this degree at UCL?</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p">The course is designed to give students both breadth and depth of study in the field at an advanced level, as well as the opportunity to develop independent research ideas in a sustained piece of original work.</p>
<p class="p"><br />Over the intensive two year programme, students taking the MPhil. Stud. complete 16 term length modules, 10 for credit assessed by way of a paper, and in addition, a 30,000 research thesis. The course is structured so that students take the majority of the assessed courses in the first year (typically 8-9), leaving them largely free to focus on their research in the second year. A certain amount of breadth is required of the courses taken for credit, so that although students are able to specialise to some extent in their area of research, they will write papers of significant length (4500 words) across several subject areas. Work on the thesis is begun in the summer of the first year and completed by September of the following year. </p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Applications and next steps</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p"> UCL Philosophy admits graduate 
students to work for the degrees of MA, MPhil Stud, MPhil/PhD, and PhD.</p>
<p class="p"> The MPhil Stud programme has been conceived as preparation 
for a career in teaching philosophy and it provides a broader background
 
and training in philosophy, before proceeding to the PhD.</p>

<h2 class="heading">Research Application Deadlines</h2>





<p class="p">  The deadline for applications to the MPhil Stud MPhil/PhD and PhD is <strong>3 January 2017</strong>. <br /></p>

<h2 class="heading">Application</h2>





<p class="p"> All applicants for research degrees (MPhil
 Stud, MPhil/PhD or PhD) should submit two short pieces of work; c. 
2,000 words each, with their application. When using the online 
admissions system there are various points where you are able to and/or 
required to upload certain documents. Please note that you are only able
 to upload documents less than 2 MB in size and in the file formats 
.doc, .docx, .jpg or .pdf. More information about uploads is available <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/apply/apply-now/ucl-graduate-application-guide-oct2013.pdf" target="_self">here</a>. </p>
<p class="p"> You can upload the writing samples instead of one of the 
other documents requested (e.g. CV, English language certificate or 
Transcript). </p>
<p class="p"> More guidance on the writing samples can be found in <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/graduate-research/philosophical-studies-mphil-stud/accordion/writing-samples" target="_self">here</a>.</p>

<h2 class="heading">Requirements</h2>





<p class="p"> <strong>MPhil Stud:</strong> a first-class UK Bachelor’s degree in Philosophy or an overseas qualification of an equivalent standard.<br /> <br /> <strong>MPhil/PhD:</strong> a one-year research degree in Philosophy or an overseas qualification of an equivalent standard.<br /><br />Exceptions may be made in the case of candidates
 with strong upper second class Honours degrees, or equivalent 
qualifications, supported by good references.<br /><br />In exceptional circumstances, applicants for research degrees 
who will have completed  sufficient graduate training in philosophy by 
the time they enrol will be considered for admission as MPhil/PhD 
students.</p>
<p class="p"> Decisions concerning eligibility for entry at this point in 
the programme will be made by the admissions tutor when reviewing 
application materials.<br /></p>
<p class="p"> The preferred route to studying for a PhD in the 
department is by taking the two year MPhil Stud degree first. When applying online for the MPhil Stud online the course code 
RMPPHISING09 in the Research Subject Area / Taught Programme Title 
section.</p>
<p class="p"> The number of new research students registering 
each year about 10. Overall there are roughly 50 research students in 
the department.</p>

<h2 class="heading">Research Affiliate Applications </h2>





<p class="p">  The department warmly welcomes graduate students 
who are working towards higher degrees at other universities and who 
would wish to do either course work or research in London for a period 
normally of one year.</p>
<p class="p"> Arrangements can be made for the award of grades 
or other credits that may be required by the degree-giving university.</p>
<p class="p"> Postdoctoral students may also be admitted for short periods, and the 
experience of the department is that such arrangements are highly 
beneficial. Finally, the department accept students who (for financial 
reasons etc.) wish to enrol on a part-time basis; and this lengthens 
their period of study. <br /></p>
<ul class="disc">
<li>For more information visit <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/study-abroad-at-ucl" target="_self">Study Abroad</a></li>
</ul>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Important Information about Writing Samples</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<ul class="disc">
<li>Writing samples are a crucial piece of our admissions process for the MPhil Stud.</li>
<li>We ask for <strong>two</strong> pieces around <strong>2000 words </strong>each (excluding bibliography). </li>
<li>The short length is because we deal with so many applications.</li>
<li>We ask for two as we do not want to make the decision on seeing only one piece of work.</li>
<li>If you send in longer pieces we cannot guarantee they will be read in their entirety.</li>
<li>Longer pieces with highlighted sections can be submitted although we would caution against this as it is not always possible to get a feel for an argument from a section. </li>
<li>Remember you are in competition with many other applicants so it is worth taking some time to work on a piece that fulfils the requirements.</li>
</ul>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Programme contacts</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>

<h2 class="heading">Contact Information</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li> 
                                                Mr Richard Edwards
                                                </li>
<li> <a href="mailto:philosophy@ucl.ac.uk">philosophy@ucl.ac.uk</a> </li>
<li> <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/graduate-research/philosophical-studies-mphil-stud/accordion/tel:+44%20%280%2920%207679%207115">+44 (0)20 7679 7115</a> </li>
</ul>
<ul class="disc">
<li> <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy">Philosophy</a> </li>
<li> <a href="https://www.google.co.uk/maps/place/University+College+London/@51.5244151,-0.1337821,17z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x48761b2f69173579:0xd008c67faecc133e" target="_self">UCL UK Campus</a> </li>
</ul>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Department Scholarships</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p">There is a list of department scholarships of the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships/graduate/deptscholarships/philosophy" target="_self">UCL funding pages</a>.</p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
</dl>
 

</div>
