<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Entry Requirements</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and Economics BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="entry-requirements">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Entry requirements</h3>
                                
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <h4>A Levels</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Grades</dt>
                                        <dd>A*AA</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>Mathematics A* required.</dd>
                                        
                                        
                                        <dt>GCSEs</dt>
                                        <dd>English Language at grade B or 6, plus Mathematics at grade C or 5. For UK-based students, a grade C or 5 or equivalent in a foreign language (other than Ancient Greek, Biblical Hebrew or Latin) is required. UCL provides opportunities to meet the foreign language requirement following enrolment, further details at: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs">www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs</a></dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    <h4>IB Diploma</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Points</dt>
                                        <dd>39</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>A total of 19 points in three higher level subjects including Mathematics grade 7, with no score below 5.</dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    
                                    <h5>UK applicants qualifications</h5>
                                    <p>For entry requirements with other UK qualifications accepted by UCL, choose your qualification from the list below:</p>
                                    <div class="dropdown">
                                        <select class="dropdown__inner dropdown_uk_qualifications">
                                            <option
    id="resetit-philosophy-economics-ba">Select qualification</option>
                                            <option
    id="btec-philosophy-economics-ba">BTEC National Diploma</option>
                                            <option
    id="accessCourse-philosophy-economics-ba">Access to HE Diploma</option>
                                            <option
    id="preU-philosophy-economics-ba">Cambridge Pre-U Principal Subjects</option>
                                            <option
    id="scotAdvancedHighers-philosophy-economics-ba">Scottish Advanced Highers</option>
                                            <option
    id="welshBacc-philosophy-economics-ba">Welsh Baccalaureate</option>
                                        </select>
                                    </div>
                                    <div
    class="box box--copy">
                                        <h5
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-economics-ba"
    id="info-heading">Equivalent qualification</h5>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-economics-ba"
    id="info-btec-philosophy-economics-ba">Not acceptable for entrance to this programme</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-economics-ba"
    id="info-accessCourse-philosophy-economics-ba">Pass in Access to HE Diploma, with a minimum of 28 credits awarded with Distinction in the Level 3 units, the remainder of the Level 3 units awarded with Merit.</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-economics-ba"
    id="info-preU-philosophy-economics-ba">D2,D3,D3 in three Cambridge Pre-U Principal Subjects. Mathematics required at D2</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-economics-ba"
    id="info-scotAdvancedHighers-philosophy-economics-ba">A1,A,A at Advanced Highers (or A1,A at Advanced Higher and A,A,A at Higher). Mathematics A1 required at Advanced Higher.</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-economics-ba"
    id="info-welshBacc-philosophy-economics-ba">Successful completion of the WBQ Advanced Skills Challenge Certificate plus 2 GCE A-Levels at grades A*AA, including Mathematics. </p>
                                    </div>
                                    
                                    <h4>Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates</h4>
                                    <p>The Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates (UPCs) are intensive one-year foundation courses for international students of high academic potential who are aiming to gain access to undergraduate degree programmes at UCL and other top UK universities.</p>
                                    <p>Typical UPC students will be high achievers in a 12-year school system which does not meet the standard required for direct entry to UCL.</p>
                                    <p>For more information see: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/upc" >www.ucl.ac.uk/upc</a>.</p>
                                    <h4>English language requirements</h4>
                                    <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency. Information about the evidence required, acceptable qualifications and test providers can be found on our <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/requirements/english-requirements'>English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                                    <p>The English language level for this programme is: <b>Advanced</b></p>
                                    <p>A variety of English language programmes are offered at the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/clie">UCL Centre for Languages & International Education</a>.</p>
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Degree Benefits</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and Economics BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="degree-benefits">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Degree benefits</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li><p>UCL Philosophy was one of the top-rated departments in the UK in the most recent (2014) Research Excellence Framework. The research interests of the academic staff are wide-ranging, covering all the main areas of philosophy.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>You will learn economics in one of Europe's leading centres for research. In the UK government's most recent (2014) Research Excellence Framework, UCL Economics was ranked top in the UK.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>A rich array of extracurricular philosophy events is available in London. As a UCL philosophy student you will be able to attend the meetings of the Royal Institute of Philosophy, the Aristotelian Society and the University of London's Institute of Philosophy.</p></li>
                                    </ul>
                                    
                                    
                                        <h2>Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2014</h2>
                                        <p>The <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ref2014">Research Excellence Framework</a>, or REF, is the system for assessing the quality of research in UK higher education institutions. The 2014 REF was carried out by the UK's higher education funding bodies, and the results used to allocate research funding from 2015/16.</p>
                                        
                                        <p>The following REF score was awarded to the department: Philosophy.</p>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li>75% rated 4* (&#145;world-leading&#146;) or 3* (&#145;internationally excellent&#146;)</li>
                                        </ul>
                                        <p>Learn more about the scope of UCL's research, and browse case studies, on our <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/impact/">Research Impact website</a>.</p>
                                    
                                    
                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Degree Structure</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and Economics BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="degree-structure">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Degree structure</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                        <p>In each year of your degree you will take a number of individual modules, normally valued at 0.5 or 1.0 credits, adding up to a total of 4.0 credits for the year. Modules are assessed in the academic year in which they are taken. The balance of compulsory and optional modules varies from programme to programme and year to year. A 1.0 credit is considered equivalent to 15 credits in the European Credit Transfer System (ECTS).</p>
                                    
                                    
                                        <p><p>The first year includes several introductory lecture courses, which provide a foundation for later studies. The programme covers political philosophy, examining questions about the state, liberty and laws; moral philosophy, questioning distinctions of right and wrong, and our motivation for choosing between the two; epistemology which investigates the nature of knowledge and belief; metaphysics, which attempts to grasp the nature of things; and logic, which imparts principles of sound reasoning.</p></p>
                                        <p><p>You will study Philosophy and Economics on a roughly equal basis.</p></p>
                                    

                                    <h4>Modules</h4>
                                    <p>An indicative guide to the structure of this programme, year by year.</p>
                                    <div class="tabs">
                                        <nav role="navigation" role="secondary" class="tabs__navigation">
                                            <ul>
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item  tabs__item--active">
                                                        <a
    href="#tab-philosophy-economics-ba-1" class="active">Year 1</a>
                                                    </li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item">
                                                        <a
    href="#tab-philosophy-economics-ba-2" class="">Year 2</a>
                                                    </li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item">
                                                        <a
    href="#tab-philosophy-economics-ba-3" class="">Year 3</a>
                                                    </li>
                                                
                                            </ul>
                                        </nav>
                                        <div class="tabs__group">
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-philosophy-economics-ba-1"
    class="tabs__item tab active">
                                                    <div class="tab__content">
                                                        <h4>
                                                            Year One
                                                        </h4>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>Economics (1.0 credits)<br/>Introduction to Mathematics for Economics (0.5 credits)</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>Four Philosophy modules from the following:<br/><br/> History of Philosophy I<br/>History of Philosophy II<br/>Knowledge and Reality<br/>Introduction to Logic I<br/>Introduction to Logic II<br/>Introduction to Moral Philosophy<br/>Introduction to Political Philosophy<br/>Philosophy Tutorial: Texts and Debate<br/><br/>You will also take one optional module from Economics.</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-philosophy-economics-ba-2"
    class="tabs__item tab">
                                                    <div class="tab__content">
                                                        <h4>
                                                            Year Two
                                                        </h4>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>Macroeconomics (1.0 credits)<br/>Macroeconomic Theory and Policy (1.0 credits)</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will select 2.0 credits of optional modules from Philosophy, including modules from at least two of the groups A, B, and C:<br/><br/>
Group A<br/>Theoretical Philosophy (e.g. Knowledge; Metaphysics; Mind and Body; Language)<br/><br/>
Group B<br/>Normative Philosophy (e.g. Aesthetics; Applied Ethics; Global Justice and Health; Morality and Literature; Normative Ethics; Political Philosophy)<br/><br/>
Group C<br/>History of Philosophy (e.g. Aristotle; Plato; Marxism; Nietzsche; Wittgenstein; Sartre)</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-philosophy-economics-ba-3"
    class="tabs__item tab">
                                                    <div class="tab__content">
                                                        <h4>
                                                            Final Year
                                                        </h4>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>All third year modules are optional.</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will select 4.0 credits of optional modules, including:<br/><br/>2.0 credits from a wide range of economics optional modules<br/>2.0 credits from the wide range of philosophy optional modules.</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                        </div>
                                    </div>
                                    <br />
                                    <h4>Your learning</h4>
                                    <p><p>Our teaching is based on lectures and seminars that complement each other. In your first year, you will be introduced to the basic elements of philosophical reasoning through lectures, seminars and small-group tutorial classes. In years two and three your chosen courses will be taught by an expert from within our department through a combination of lectures, related seminars and classes.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h4>Assessment</h4>
                                    <p><p>Assessment is by a mixture of coursework (essays) and written examination. You may also elect to submit a dissertation as one of your Philosophy optional modules.</p></p>
                                    
                                <h4>Further Information</h4>
                                
                                <p>Detailed course descriptions are available on the department website: <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/undergraduate"
    class="clicktracker departmentlink">Philosophy and Economics BA</a>.</p>
                                
                                </div>
                            </section>

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Careers</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and Economics BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="careers">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Careers</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <p><p>This programme will assist you in constructing and assessing philosophical positions and arguments, thereby teaching you how to analyse and present complex ideas. Furthermore, it will provide you with an understanding of a wide range of traditional and contemporary philosophical theories. Such skills are transferable to non-philosophical contexts.</p></p>
                                    
                                        <p><p>The discipline of philosophical training, and in particular its emphasis on rigorous argumentation, logic, and clarity of thought and expression, makes philosophy graduates highly suitable for a wide variety of careers.</p></p>
                                    
                                    
                                        <p><p>Many recent UCL graduates have excelled in the legal profession, training as both solicitors and barristers, while others have entered publishing, journalism, finance, the civil service, Parliament, or local government. Philosophy graduates are also sought after as programmers and systems analysts. A high proportion of students go on to further study in philosophy.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h4>Destinations</h4>
                                    <p>First career destinations of recent graduates (2013-2015) of this programme include:</p>
                                    <ul>
                                        
                                            <li>Analyst, Royal Bank of Canada (RBC)</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Full-time student, MA in Economics at Yale University</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Full-time student, MPhil in Political Thought and Intellectual History at University of Cambridge</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Investment Banker, J.P. Morgan</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Full-time student, MPhil in Management at the University of Cambridge</li>
                                        
                                    </ul>
                        
                                    
                                    <p
    class="small text-muted">Data taken from the 'Destinations of Leavers from Higher Education' survey undertaken by HESA looking at the destinations of UK and EU students in the 2013-2015 graduating cohorts six months after graduation.</p>
                                    <p>UCL is commited to helping you get the best start after graduation. Read more about how UCL Careers and UCL Innovation and Enterprise can <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/employability/careers-skills'>help you find employment or learn about entrepreneurship</a>.</p>
                                    
                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Fees and Funding</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>



<h4 class="heading">Fees</h4>



<dl class="dl" compact="compact">
<dt>UK &amp; EU fee</dt>
  <dd>£9,000 (2016/17)</dd>
<dt>Overseas fee</dt>
  <dd>£16,130 (2016/17)</dd>
</dl>



<h4 class="heading">Funding</h4>



<p class="p">Details about financial support are available at: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/study/ug-finance">www.ucl.ac.uk/study/ug-finance</a></p>



<h4 class="heading">Scholarships</h4>



<p class="p">The <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/scholarships">Scholarships and Funding</a> website has a comprehensive list of scholarships and funding schemes available for UCL students. These can be available for specific nationalities, regions, departments or open to all students.</p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Application and next steps</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and Economics BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy zero-bottom" id="application">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h3>

                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                    
                                        <h4>Your application</h4>
                                        <p><p>In addition to looking for outstanding grades in your academic record as a whole, and in mathematics in particular, we also assess your application for evidence of your ability to engage with philosophical arguments and your skills in reasoning.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h4>How to apply</h4>
                                    <p>Application for admission should be made through UCAS (the Universities and Colleges Admissions Service). Applicants currently at school or college will be provided with advice on the process; however, applicants who have left school or who are based outside the United Kingdom may obtain information directly from UCAS.</p>
                                    
                                    <p>
                                        <strong>Application deadline:</strong>
                                        15 January 2018                    
                                    </p>
                                    
                                    <br />
                                    <ul class="list-unstyled list-inline list-inline--btn hidden-lg">
                                        <li>
                                            
                                                    <a
    class="btn cta" href="http://www.ucas.com"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','UG (widget) apply clicks','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/undergraduate/philosophy-economics-ba'])">Apply through UCAS</a>
                                          
                                        </li>
                                        <li>
                                            <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/undergraduate/application/application/how-to-apply">Application guidelines</a>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul> 
                                    <br /><br />
                                    <h4>Selection</h4>
                                    <p><p>Selection will be made on the basis of information contained in the UCAS application: achieved and predicted academic grades, the level of interest in, motivation towards, and experience of the subject as indicated in the personal statement, the reference supplied, and any relevant contextual factors.</p></p>
                                    <p><p>In addition applicants may be asked from time to time to provide further information, such as AS module results, or a response to a questionnaire.</p></p>
                                    <p>For further information on UCL's selection process see: <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/selection'>Selection of students</a>.</p>
                                    <ul class="list-unstyled list-inline list-inline--btn hidden-lg">
                                        <li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/ucl-plus" class="btn btn--secondary">Request a printed prospectus <i class="icon icon--book icon--push-left pull-right"></i></a>
                                        </li>
                                        <li><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/download" class="btn btn--secondary">Download prospectus <i class="icon icon--download icon--push-left pull-right"></i></a>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                    <br /><br />
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>

    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">The Academic Voice</h1>


<h3 class="heading"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/undergraduate/philosophy-economics-ba/columns/academic-voice">The Academic Voice</a></h3>




<a class="image" href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/undergraduate/philosophy-economics-ba/columns/academic-voice" title="Statue on UCL Portico" target="_self"><img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/images/images-for-prospective-student-pages/UCL_Portico_statue.jpg" width="313" height="208" alt="Statue on UCL Portico" class="small-image" title="Statue on UCL Portico" /></a>

<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>
                     <div class="content-sidebar">
                                        <div class="site-content__sidebar">

<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--None">
  
  <i class="fa None"></i> 
  <h2 class="heading">UCL+</h2>
<ul class="disc">
<li>Register interest in your chosen subjects</li>
<li>Request a printed prospectus</li>
<li>Receive notice of undergraduate open days, events and more</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/ucl-plus" target="_self">Sign Up ...&gt;&gt;</a></li>
</ul>


</section>

</div>

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and Greek BA</h2>

                        
                            <div class="copy__section copy__anchor scrollspy" id="standfirst">
                                <p class="copy__intro">This degree aims to provide an understanding of a range of central philosophical debates, together with a detailed education in Ancient Greek language and culture. All major areas of philosophy are available for study, drawing upon the writings of philosophers both ancient and modern to place your studies in context.</p>
                            </div>
                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Entry Requirements</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and Greek BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="entry-requirements">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Entry requirements</h3>
                                
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <h4>A Levels</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Grades</dt>
                                        <dd>AAA</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>No specific subjects.</dd>
                                        
                                        
                                        <dt>GCSEs</dt>
                                        <dd>English Language at grade B or 6, plus Mathematics at grade C or 5; Ancient Greek is also preferred. For UK-based students, a grade C or 5 or equivalent in a foreign language (other than Ancient Greek, Biblical Hebrew or Latin) is required. UCL provides opportunities to meet the foreign language requirement following enrolment, further details at: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs">www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs</a></dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    <h4>IB Diploma</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Points</dt>
                                        <dd>38</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>A total of 18 points in three higher level subjects, with no score below 5.</dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    
                                    <h5>UK applicants qualifications</h5>
                                    <p>For entry requirements with other UK qualifications accepted by UCL, choose your qualification from the list below:</p>
                                    <div class="dropdown">
                                        <select class="dropdown__inner dropdown_uk_qualifications">
                                            <option
    id="resetit-philosophy-greek-ba">Select qualification</option>
                                            <option
    id="btec-philosophy-greek-ba">BTEC National Diploma</option>
                                            <option
    id="accessCourse-philosophy-greek-ba">Access to HE Diploma</option>
                                            <option
    id="preU-philosophy-greek-ba">Cambridge Pre-U Principal Subjects</option>
                                            <option
    id="scotAdvancedHighers-philosophy-greek-ba">Scottish Advanced Highers</option>
                                            <option
    id="welshBacc-philosophy-greek-ba">Welsh Baccalaureate</option>
                                        </select>
                                    </div>
                                    <div
    class="box box--copy">
                                        <h5
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-greek-ba"
    id="info-heading">Equivalent qualification</h5>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-greek-ba"
    id="info-btec-philosophy-greek-ba">Not acceptable for entrance to this programme</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-greek-ba"
    id="info-accessCourse-philosophy-greek-ba">Pass in Access to HE Diploma, with a minimum of 23 credits awarded with Distinction in the Level 3 units, the remainder of the Level 3 units awarded with Merit.</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-greek-ba"
    id="info-preU-philosophy-greek-ba">D3,D3,D3 in three Cambridge Pre-U Principal Subjects</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-greek-ba"
    id="info-scotAdvancedHighers-philosophy-greek-ba">A,A,A at Advanced Highers (or A,A at Advanced Higher and A,A,A at Higher) </p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-greek-ba"
    id="info-welshBacc-philosophy-greek-ba">Successful completion of the WBQ Advanced Skills Challenge Certificate plus 2 GCE A-Levels at grades AAA. </p>
                                    </div>
                                    
                                    <h4>Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates</h4>
                                    <p>The Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates (UPCs) are intensive one-year foundation courses for international students of high academic potential who are aiming to gain access to undergraduate degree programmes at UCL and other top UK universities.</p>
                                    <p>Typical UPC students will be high achievers in a 12-year school system which does not meet the standard required for direct entry to UCL.</p>
                                    <p>For more information see: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/upc" >www.ucl.ac.uk/upc</a>.</p>
                                    <h4>English language requirements</h4>
                                    <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency. Information about the evidence required, acceptable qualifications and test providers can be found on our <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/requirements/english-requirements'>English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                                    <p>The English language level for this programme is: <b>Advanced</b></p>
                                    <p>A variety of English language programmes are offered at the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/clie">UCL Centre for Languages & International Education</a>.</p>
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Degree Benefits</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and Greek BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="degree-benefits">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Degree benefits</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li><p>UCL Philosophy was one of the top-rated departments in the UK in the most recent (2014) Research Excellence Framework. The research interests of the academic staff are wide-ranging, covering all the main areas of philosophy.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>You will study Greek in one of the top five Classics departments in the UK, according to the 2017 <em>Guardian University Guide.<br/></em></p></li>
                                        <li><p>A rich array of extracurricular philosophy events is available in London. As a UCL philosophy student you will be able to attend the meetings of the Royal Institute of Philosophy, the Aristotelian Society and the University of London's Institute of Philosophy.</p></li>
                                    </ul>
                                    
                                    
                                        <h2>Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2014</h2>
                                        <p>The <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ref2014">Research Excellence Framework</a>, or REF, is the system for assessing the quality of research in UK higher education institutions. The 2014 REF was carried out by the UK's higher education funding bodies, and the results used to allocate research funding from 2015/16.</p>
                                        
                                        <p>The following REF score was awarded to the department: Philosophy.</p>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li>75% rated 4* (&#145;world-leading&#146;) or 3* (&#145;internationally excellent&#146;)</li>
                                        </ul>
                                        <p>Learn more about the scope of UCL's research, and browse case studies, on our <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/impact/">Research Impact website</a>.</p>
                                    
                                    
                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Degree Structure</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and Greek BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="degree-structure">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Degree structure</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                        <p>In each year of your degree you will take a number of individual modules, normally valued at 0.5 or 1.0 credits, adding up to a total of 4.0 credits for the year. Modules are assessed in the academic year in which they are taken. The balance of compulsory and optional modules varies from programme to programme and year to year. A 1.0 credit is considered equivalent to 15 credits in the European Credit Transfer System (ECTS).</p>
                                    
                                    
                                        <p><p>The first year includes several introductory lecture courses, which provide a foundation for later studies. The programme covers political philosophy, examining questions about the state, liberty and laws; moral philosophy, questioning distinctions of right and wrong, and our motivation for choosing between the two; epistemology which investigates the nature of knowledge and belief; metaphysics, which attempts to grasp the nature of things; and logic, which imparts principles of sound reasoning.</p></p>
                                        <p><p>You will study Philosophy and Greek on an equal basis. Optional modules in Latin are also offered.</p></p>
                                    

                                    <h4>Modules</h4>
                                    <p>An indicative guide to the structure of this programme, year by year.</p>
                                    <div class="tabs">
                                        <nav role="navigation" role="secondary" class="tabs__navigation">
                                            <ul>
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item  tabs__item--active">
                                                        <a
    href="#tab-philosophy-greek-ba-1" class="active">Year 1</a>
                                                    </li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item">
                                                        <a
    href="#tab-philosophy-greek-ba-2" class="">Year 2</a>
                                                    </li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item">
                                                        <a
    href="#tab-philosophy-greek-ba-3" class="">Year 3</a>
                                                    </li>
                                                
                                            </ul>
                                        </nav>
                                        <div class="tabs__group">
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-philosophy-greek-ba-1"
    class="tabs__item tab active">
                                                    <div class="tab__content">
                                                        <h4>
                                                            Year One
                                                        </h4>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>All first year modules are optional.</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will select 4.0 credits of optional modules, including: 2.0 credits of Greek &amp; Latin modules<br/><br/>Four Philosophy modules from the following:<br/>Introduction to the History of Philosophy I<br/>Introduction to the History of Philosophy II<br/>Introduction to Logic I<br/>Introduction to Logic II<br/>Introduction to Moral Philosophy<br/>Introduction to Political Philosophy<br/>Knowledge and Reality <br/>Philosophy Tutoria: Texts and Debate</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-philosophy-greek-ba-2" class="tabs__item tab">
                                                    <div class="tab__content">
                                                        <h4>
                                                            Year Two
                                                        </h4>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>All second year modules are optional.</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will select 4.0 credits of optional modules, including:<br/><br/>2.0 credits of Greek &amp; Latin modules<br/><br/>Four optional modules from Philosophy, including modules from at least two of the groups A, B, and C:<br/><br/> Group A<br/>Theoretical Philosophy (e.g. Knowledge; Metaphysics; Mind and Body; Language)<br/><br/> Group B<br/>Normative Philosophy (e.g. Aesthetics; Applied Ethics; Global Justice and Health; Morality and Literature; Normative Ethics; Political Philosophy)<br/><br/> Group C<br/>History of Philosophy (Aristotle; Plato; Marxism; Nietzsche; Wittgenstein; Sartre)</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-philosophy-greek-ba-3" class="tabs__item tab">
                                                    <div class="tab__content">
                                                        <h4>
                                                            Final Year
                                                        </h4>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>All third year modules are optional.</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will select 4.0 credits of optional modules, including:<br/><br/>2.0 credits of Greek &amp; Latin modules<br/><br/>2.0 credits from the wide range of Philosophy modules available.</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                        </div>
                                    </div>
                                    <br />
                                    <h4>Your learning</h4>
                                    <p><p>Our teaching is based on lectures and seminars that complement each other. In your first year, you will be introduced to the basic elements of philosophical reasoning through lectures, seminars and small-group tutorial classes. In years two and three your chosen modules will be taught by an expert from within our department through a combination of lectures, related seminars and classes.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h4>Assessment</h4>
                                    <p><p>Assessment is by a mixture of coursework (essays) and written examination. You may also elect to submit a dissertation as one of your Philosophy optional modules.</p></p>
                                    
                                <h4>Further Information</h4>
                                
                                <p>Detailed course descriptions are available on the department website: <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/undergraduate"
    class="clicktracker departmentlink">Philosophy and Greek BA</a>.</p>
                                
                                </div>
                            </section>

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Careers</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and Greek BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="careers">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Careers</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <p><p>This programme will assist you in constructing and assessing philosophical positions and arguments, thereby teaching you how to analyse and present complex ideas. Furthermore, it will provide you with an understanding of a wide range of traditional and contemporary philosophical theories. Such skills are transferable to non-philosophical contexts.</p></p>
                                    
                                        <p><p>The discipline of philosophical training, and in particular its emphasis on rigorous argumentation, logic, and clarity of thought and expression, makes philosophy graduates highly suitable for a wide variety of careers.</p></p>
                                    
                                    
                                        <p><p>Many recent UCL graduates have excelled in the legal profession, training as both solicitors and barristers, while others have entered publishing, journalism, finance, the civil service, Parliament, or local government. Philosophy graduates are also sought after as programmers and systems analysts. A high proportion of students go on to further study in philosophy.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h4>Destinations</h4>
                                    <p>First career destinations of recent graduates (2013-2015) of this programme include:</p>
                                    <ul>
                                        
                                            <li>Graduate Trainee, KPMG</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Full-time student, MSt in Philosophy at the University of Oxford</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Future Leader, Barclays</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Full-time student, BPhil in Philosophy at the University of Oxford</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Journalist, Banbury Guardian (2011)</li>
                                        
                                    </ul>
                        
                                    
                                    <p
    class="small text-muted">Data taken from the 'Destinations of Leavers from Higher Education' survey undertaken by HESA looking at the destinations of UK and EU students in the 2013-2015 graduating cohorts six months after graduation.</p>
                                    <p>UCL is commited to helping you get the best start after graduation. Read more about how UCL Careers and UCL Innovation and Enterprise can <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/employability/careers-skills'>help you find employment or learn about entrepreneurship</a>.</p>
                                    
                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Fees and Funding</a></dt>

     <div>

<dl class="dl" compact="compact">
<dt>UK &amp; EU fee</dt>
  <dd>£9,000 (2016/17)</dd>
<dt>Overseas fee</dt>
  <dd>£16,130 (2016/17)</dd>
</dl>



<h4 class="heading">Funding</h4>



<p class="p">Details about financial support are available at: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/study/ug-finance">www.ucl.ac.uk/study/ug-finance</a></p>



<h4 class="heading">Scholarships</h4>



<p class="p">The <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/scholarships">Scholarships and Funding</a> website has a comprehensive list of scholarships and funding schemes available for UCL students. These can be available for specific nationalities, regions, departments or open to all students.</p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Application and next steps</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and Greek BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy zero-bottom" id="application">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h3>

                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                    
                                        <h4>Your application</h4>
                                        <p><p>In addition to looking for outstanding grades in your academic record, we also assess your application for evidence of your ability to engage with philosophical arguments, your skills in reasoning, and your facility with languages and linguistics.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h4>How to apply</h4>
                                    <p>Application for admission should be made through UCAS (the Universities and Colleges Admissions Service). Applicants currently at school or college will be provided with advice on the process; however, applicants who have left school or who are based outside the United Kingdom may obtain information directly from UCAS.</p>
                                    
                                    <p>
                                        <strong>Application deadline:</strong>
                                        15 January 2018                    
                                    </p>
                                    
                                    <br />
                                    <ul class="list-unstyled list-inline list-inline--btn hidden-lg">
                                        <li>
                                            
                                                    <a
    class="btn cta" href="http://www.ucas.com"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','UG (widget) apply clicks','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/undergraduate/philosophy-greek-ba'])">Apply through UCAS</a>
                                          
                                        </li>
                                        <li>
                                            <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/undergraduate/application/application/how-to-apply">Application guidelines</a>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul> 
                                    <br /><br />
                                    <h4>Selection</h4>
                                    <p><p>Selection will be made on the basis of information contained in the UCAS application: achieved and predicted academic grades, the level of interest in, motivation towards, and experience of the subject as indicated in the personal statement, the reference supplied, and any relevant contextual factors.</p></p>
                                    <p><p>In addition applicants may be asked from time to time to provide further information, such as AS module results, or a response to a questionnaire.</p></p>
                                    <p>For further information on UCL's selection process see: <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/selection'>Selection of students</a>.</p>
                                    <ul class="list-unstyled list-inline list-inline--btn hidden-lg">
                                        <li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/ucl-plus" class="btn btn--secondary">Request a printed prospectus <i class="icon icon--book icon--push-left pull-right"></i></a>
                                        </li>
                                        <li><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/download" class="btn btn--secondary">Download prospectus <i class="icon icon--download icon--push-left pull-right"></i></a>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                    <br /><br />
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>

<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">

                        <article class="article clearfix">

            require(["theme/ug"]);

                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and History of Art BA</h2>

                        
                            <div class="copy__section copy__anchor scrollspy" id="standfirst">
                                <p class="copy__intro">This degree aims to provide you with an understanding of a range of central philosophical debates together with a detailed education in history of art. All major areas of philosophy are available for study. You will also address issues about the very nature of art and human perception of visual culture.</p>
                            </div>
                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>
