<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Entry Requirements</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and History of Art BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="entry-requirements">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Entry requirements</h3>
                                
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <h4>A Levels</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Grades</dt>
                                        <dd>AAA</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>No specific subjects.</dd>
                                        
                                        
                                        <dt>GCSEs</dt>
                                        <dd>English Language at grade B or 6, plus Mathematics at grade C or 5. For UK-based students, a grade C or 5 or equivalent in a foreign language (other than Ancient Greek, Biblical Hebrew or Latin) is required. UCL provides opportunities to meet the foreign language requirement following enrolment, further details at: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs">www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs</a></dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    <h4>IB Diploma</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Points</dt>
                                        <dd>38</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>A total of 18 points in three higher level subjects, with no score below 5.</dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    
                                    <h5>UK applicants qualifications</h5>
                                    <p>For entry requirements with other UK qualifications accepted by UCL, choose your qualification from the list below:</p>
                                    <div class="dropdown">
                                        <select class="dropdown__inner dropdown_uk_qualifications">
                                            <option
    id="resetit-philosophy-history-art-ba">Select qualification</option>
                                            <option
    id="btec-philosophy-history-art-ba">BTEC National Diploma</option>
                                            <option
    id="accessCourse-philosophy-history-art-ba">Access to HE Diploma</option>
                                            <option
    id="preU-philosophy-history-art-ba">Cambridge Pre-U Principal Subjects</option>
                                            <option
    id="scotAdvancedHighers-philosophy-history-art-ba">Scottish Advanced Highers</option>
                                            <option
    id="welshBacc-philosophy-history-art-ba">Welsh Baccalaureate</option>
                                        </select>
                                    </div>
                                    <div
    class="box box--copy">
                                        <h5
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-history-art-ba"
    id="info-heading">Equivalent qualification</h5>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-history-art-ba"
    id="info-btec-philosophy-history-art-ba">Not acceptable for entrance to this programme</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-history-art-ba"
    id="info-accessCourse-philosophy-history-art-ba">Pass in Access to HE Diploma, with a minimum of 23 credits awarded with Distinction in the Level 3 units, the remainder of the Level 3 units awarded with Merit.</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-history-art-ba"
    id="info-preU-philosophy-history-art-ba">D3,D3,D3 in three Cambridge Pre-U Principal Subjects</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-history-art-ba"
    id="info-scotAdvancedHighers-philosophy-history-art-ba">A,A,A at Advanced Highers (or A,A at Advanced Higher and A,A,A at Higher) </p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-philosophy-history-art-ba"
    id="info-welshBacc-philosophy-history-art-ba">Successful completion of the WBQ Advanced Skills Challenge Certificate plus 2 GCE A-Levels at grades AAA. </p>
                                    </div>
                                    
                                    <h4>Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates</h4>
                                    <p>The Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates (UPCs) are intensive one-year foundation courses for international students of high academic potential who are aiming to gain access to undergraduate degree programmes at UCL and other top UK universities.</p>
                                    <p>Typical UPC students will be high achievers in a 12-year school system which does not meet the standard required for direct entry to UCL.</p>
                                    <p>For more information see: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/upc" >www.ucl.ac.uk/upc</a>.</p>
                                    <h4>English language requirements</h4>
                                    <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency. Information about the evidence required, acceptable qualifications and test providers can be found on our <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/requirements/english-requirements'>English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                                    <p>The English language level for this programme is: <b>Advanced</b></p>
                                    <p>A variety of English language programmes are offered at the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/clie">UCL Centre for Languages & International Education</a>.</p>
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Degree Benefits</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and History of Art BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="degree-benefits">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Degree benefits</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li><p>UCL Philosophy was one of the top-rated departments in the UK in the most recent (2014) Research Excellence Framework. The research interests of the academic staff are wide-ranging, covering all the main areas of philosophy.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>UCL History of Art academic staff include specialists on all periods from the early Renaissance onwards, with particular strength in the study of contemporary art and two experts in the technical analysis of paintings.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>A rich array of extracurricular philosophy events is available in London. As a UCL philosophy student you will be able to attend the meetings of the Royal Institute of Philosophy, the Aristotelian Society and the University of London's Institute of Philosophy.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>UCL's central location in London is within walking distance of the British Museum and provides easy access to the National Gallery, the Tate Galleries and the Victoria and Albert Museum.</p></li>
                                    </ul>
                                    
                                    
                                        <h2>Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2014</h2>
                                        <p>The <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ref2014">Research Excellence Framework</a>, or REF, is the system for assessing the quality of research in UK higher education institutions. The 2014 REF was carried out by the UK's higher education funding bodies, and the results used to allocate research funding from 2015/16.</p>
                                        
                                        <p>The following REF score was awarded to the department: Philosophy.</p>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li>75% rated 4* (&#145;world-leading&#146;) or 3* (&#145;internationally excellent&#146;)</li>
                                        </ul>
                                        <p>Learn more about the scope of UCL's research, and browse case studies, on our <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/impact/">Research Impact website</a>.</p>
                                    
                                    
                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Degree Structure</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and History of Art BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="degree-structure">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Degree structure</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                        <p>In each year of your degree you will take a number of individual modules, normally valued at 0.5 or 1.0 credits, adding up to a total of 4.0 credits for the year. Modules are assessed in the academic year in which they are taken. The balance of compulsory and optional modules varies from programme to programme and year to year. A 1.0 credit is considered equivalent to 15 credits in the European Credit Transfer System (ECTS).</p>
                                    
                                    
                                        <p><p>The first year includes several introductory lecture courses, which provide a foundation for later studies. The programme covers political philosophy, examining questions about the state, liberty and laws; moral philosophy, questioning distinctions of right and wrong, and our motivation for choosing between the two; epistemology which investigates the nature of knowledge and belief; metaphysics, which attempts to grasp the nature of things; and logic, which imparts principles of sound reasoning.</p></p>
                                        <p><p>You will study Philosophy and History of Art on an equal basis.</p></p>
                                    

                                    <h4>Modules</h4>
                                    <p>An indicative guide to the structure of this programme, year by year.</p>
                                    <div class="tabs">
                                        <nav role="navigation" role="secondary" class="tabs__navigation">
                                            <ul>
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item  tabs__item--active">
                                                        <a
    href="#tab-philosophy-history-art-ba-1" class="active">Year 1</a>
                                                    </li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item">
                                                        <a
    href="#tab-philosophy-history-art-ba-2" class="">Year 2</a>
                                                    </li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li
    class="tabs__item">
                                                        <a
    href="#tab-philosophy-history-art-ba-3" class="">Year 3</a>
                                                    </li>
                                                
                                            </ul>
                                        </nav>
                                        <div class="tabs__group">
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-philosophy-history-art-ba-1"
    class="tabs__item tab active">
                                                    <div class="tab__content">
                                                        <h4>
                                                            Year One
                                                        </h4>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>History of Art and its Objects<br/>History of European Art (1): Classical to Early Renaissance<br/>History of European Art (2): High Renaissance to Present Day</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will select 2.0 credits from the following:<br/><br/>Introduction to the History of Philosophy I<br/>Introduction to the History of Philosophy II<br/>Introduction to Logic I<br/>Introduction to Logic II<br/>Introduction to Moral Philosophy<br/>Introduction to Political Philosophy<br/>Knowledge and Reality<br/>Philosophy Tutorial: Texts and Debate</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-philosophy-history-art-ba-2"
    class="tabs__item tab">
                                                    <div class="tab__content">
                                                        <h4>
                                                            Year Two
                                                        </h4>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>Gateway I (History of Art)<br/>Gateway II (History of Art)</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will select 1.0 credit from a selection of optional History of Art modules and four optional modules from Philosophy, including modules from at least two of the groups A, B, and C:<br/><br/> Group A<br/>Theoretical Philosophy (e.g. Knowledge; Metaphysics; Mind and Body; Language)<br/><br/>Group B<br/>Normative Philosophy (e.g. Aesthetics; Applied Ethics; Global Justice and Health; Morality and Literature; Normative Ethics; Political Philosophy)<br/><br/> Group C<br/>History of Philosophy (e.g. Aristotle; Plato; Marxism; Nietzsche; Wittgenstein; Sartre)</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                            
                                                <div
    id="tab-philosophy-history-art-ba-3"
    class="tabs__item tab">
                                                    <div class="tab__content">
                                                        <h4>
                                                            Final Year
                                                        </h4>
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Core or compulsory module(s)
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>All third-year modules are optional.</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                        <h5>
                                                            Optional modules
                                                        </h5>
                                                        
                                                            <p>
                                                                <p>You will choose four History of Art optional modules (to the value of 2.0 credits) from the wide range available. You will also select four Philosophy modules (to the value of 2.0 credits) in year two. A maximum of 1.0 credit may be taken in other UCL departments in years two and three.</p>
                                                            </p>
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                        </div>
                                    </div>
                                    <br />
                                    <h4>Your learning</h4>
                                    <p><p>Our teaching is based on lectures and seminars that complement each other. In your first year, you will be introduced to the basic elements of philosophical reasoning through lectures, seminars and small-group tutorial classes. In years two and three your chosen modules will be taught by departmental experts through a combination of lectures, related seminars and classes.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h4>Assessment</h4>
                                    <p><p>Assessment is by a mixture of coursework (essays) and written examination. You may also elect to submit a dissertation as one of your Philosophy optional modules.</p></p>
                                    
                                <h4>Further Information</h4>
                                
                                <p>Detailed course descriptions are available on the department website: <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/undergraduate"
    class="clicktracker departmentlink">Philosophy and History of Art BA</a>.</p>
                                
                                </div>
                            </section>

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Careers</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and History of Art BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="careers">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Careers</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <p><p>This programme will assist you in constructing and assessing philosophical positions and arguments, thereby teaching you how to analyse and present complex ideas. Furthermore, it will provide you with an understanding of a wide range of traditional and contemporary philosophical theories. Such skills are transferable to non-philosophical contexts.</p></p>
                                    
                                        <p><p>The discipline of philosophical training, and in particular its emphasis on rigorous argumentation, logic, and clarity of thought and expression, makes philosophy graduates highly suitable for a wide variety of careers.</p></p>
                                    
                                    
                                        <p><p>Many recent UCL graduates have excelled in the legal profession, training as both solicitors and barristers, while others have entered publishing, journalism, finance, the civil service, Parliament, or local government. Philosophy graduates are also sought after as programmers and systems analysts. A high proportion of students go on to further study in philosophy.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h4>Destinations</h4>
                                    <p>First career destinations of recent graduates (2013-2015) of this programme include:</p>
                                    <ul>
                                        
                                            <li>Graduate Trainee, Sotheby's</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Full-time student, Graduate Diploma in Law at BPP University</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Trainee ABA Tutor, Ambitious About Autism</li>
                                        
                                    </ul>
                        
                                    
                                    <p
    class="small text-muted">Data taken from the 'Destinations of Leavers from Higher Education' survey undertaken by HESA looking at the destinations of UK and EU students in the 2013-2015 graduating cohorts six months after graduation.</p>
                                    <p>UCL is commited to helping you get the best start after graduation. Read more about how UCL Careers and UCL Innovation and Enterprise can <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/employability/careers-skills'>help you find employment or learn about entrepreneurship</a>.</p>
                                    
                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Fees and Funding</a></dt>

     <div>



<h4 class="heading">Fees</h4>



<dl class="dl" compact="compact">
<dt>UK &amp; EU fee</dt>
  <dd>£9,000 (2016/17)</dd>
<dt>Overseas fee</dt>
  <dd>£16,130 (2016/17)</dd>
</dl>



<h4 class="heading">Funding</h4>



<p class="p">Details about financial support are available at: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/study/ug-finance">www.ucl.ac.uk/study/ug-finance</a></p>



<h4 class="heading">Scholarships</h4>



<p class="p">The <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/scholarships">Scholarships and Funding</a> website has a comprehensive list of scholarships and funding schemes available for UCL students. These can be available for specific nationalities, regions, departments or open to all students. </p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Application and next steps</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and History of Art BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy zero-bottom" id="application">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h3>

                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                    
                                        <h4>Your application</h4>
                                        <p><p>In addition to looking for outstanding grades in your academic record, we also assess your application for evidence of your ability to engage with philosophical arguments, your skills in reasoning and your interest in history of art.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h4>How to apply</h4>
                                    <p>Application for admission should be made through UCAS (the Universities and Colleges Admissions Service). Applicants currently at school or college will be provided with advice on the process; however, applicants who have left school or who are based outside the United Kingdom may obtain information directly from UCAS.</p>
                                    
                                    <p>
                                        <strong>Application deadline:</strong>
                                        15 January 2018                    
                                    </p>
                                    
                                    <br />
                                    <ul class="list-unstyled list-inline list-inline--btn hidden-lg">
                                        <li>
                                            
                                                    <a
    class="btn cta" href="http://www.ucas.com"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','UG (widget) apply clicks','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/undergraduate/philosophy-history-of-art-ba'])">Apply through UCAS</a>
                                          
                                        </li>
                                        <li>
                                            <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/undergraduate/application/application/how-to-apply">Application guidelines</a>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul> 
                                    <br /><br />
                                    <h4>Selection</h4>
                                    <p><p>Selection will be made on the basis of information contained in the UCAS application: achieved and predicted academic grades, the level of interest in, motivation towards, and experience of the subject as indicated in the personal statement, the reference supplied, and any relevant contextual factors.</p></p>
                                    <p><p>In addition applicants may be asked from time to time to provide further information, such as AS module results, or a response to a questionnaire.</p></p>
                                    <p>For further information on UCL's selection process see: <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/selection'>Selection of students</a>.</p>
                                    <ul class="list-unstyled list-inline list-inline--btn hidden-lg">
                                        <li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/ucl-plus" class="btn btn--secondary">Request a printed prospectus <i class="icon icon--book icon--push-left pull-right"></i></a>
                                        </li>
                                        <li><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/download" class="btn btn--secondary">Download prospectus <i class="icon icon--download icon--push-left pull-right"></i></a>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                    <br /><br />
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Programme contacts</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Why UCL Philosophy?</h1>
<p class="p">Philosophy was from the very foundation of UCL always intended 
to play a large and important part in the curriculum. This was in 
keeping with the idea of philosophy as a means of liberal education held
 by such members of the original council as James Mill, Henry Brougham 
and George Grote.</p>
<p class="p"> In the first statement, issued in 1827, concerning the
 nature and objectives of the college's foundation, it states:<br /></p>


  <blockquote class="pull-quote__wrap clearfix">
    <span class="pull-quote__start">"</span>
     &quot;As the Physical Sciences aim at ascertaining the most general facts observed by sense in the things which are the object of thought, so the Mental Sciences seek to determine the most general facts relating to thought or feeling, which are made known to the being who thinks by his own consciousness&quot;.

  </blockquote>
  

<p class="p"> The department has notable strengths in:</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li>Philosophy of Mind and 
Language</li>
<li>Philosophy of Perception</li>
<li>Political and Moral Philosophy</li>
<li>Metaphysics and Epistemology</li>
<li>History of Philosophy</li>
<li>Ancient Philosophy</li>
<li>Kantian and post-Kantian continental philosophy</li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">Other Resources:</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/student-testimonials">Read Student Testimonies</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/alumni/phd-placement-record" target="_self">View PhD Placement Record</a></li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">Unistats</h2>





<p class="p"> Compare UCL's Philosophy programmes with others:<a href="http://unistats.direct.gov.uk/Subjects/Overview/10007784-UBAESPSSTU05" target="_self"><br /></a></p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://unistats.direct.gov.uk/Search/SubjectList/093/ReturnTo/Subjects" target="_self">Unistats</a></li>
</ul>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">

                    </div>

                </div>
            </div>
        </div>

  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);

  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";

  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  };

  doc.close();
})();

                                    <a id="navigation" name="navigation"></a>
                                            
          <!--Start Generate Menu-->
              
                <h6 class="vlist">Information for Prospective Students</h6>
                <ul class="vlist"> 
<li id="home-link_li"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/home-link" class="home-link">Prospective Students</a></li>

<!-- start main slot where silva content gets rendered--> 
	<h2 class="heading">Scholarships and Funding</h2>

<h3 class="heading">Philosophy</h3>





<table class="silvatable table" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="100%" class="align-center" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-center">
  <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships/faq/" target="_self">Important information for Students</a>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>


<h4 class="heading">Philosophy MPhil/PhD Research Scholarships</h4>








<h6 class="heading">AJ Ayer Scholarship in Philosophy </h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: Up to £3,500</p>




<h6 class="heading">AJ Ayer-Sumitomo Corporation Scholarship in Philosophy </h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: Up to £800</p>




<h6 class="heading">Dawes Hicks Postgraduate Scholarships in Philosophy </h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: Up to £5,000</p>




<h6 class="heading">Downing Postgraduate Scholarship in Philosophy </h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: Up to £250</p>




<h6 class="heading">Follett Scholarship</h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: Up to £13,000</p>




<h6 class="heading">Jacobsen Scholarship in Philosophy</h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: Up to £9,500</p>




<h6 class="heading">Keeling Scholarship</h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: UK/EU tuition fees plus a bursary</p>




<h6 class="heading">John Stuart Mill Scholarship in Philosophy of Mind and Logic</h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: Up to £1,400</p>




<h6 class="heading">The George Melhuish Postgraduate Scholarships </h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: Up to £3,700</p>



<h5 class="heading">Deadline</h5>



<p class="p">n/a</p>



<h5 class="heading">Application and Information</h5>



<p class="p">No separate application is required for the above scholarships. All who are admitted to research programmes in Philosophy will be invited to apply, and decisions regarding these awards will be made in September. </p>
<p class="p">Queries should be directed to: <br /></p>
<p class="p">Dr. Fiona Leigh: <a href="mailto:fiona.leigh@ucl.ac.uk">fiona.leigh@ucl.ac.uk</a></p>
<p class="p">Telephone +44 (0)20 7679 3074</p>


<!-- end main slot where silva content gets rendered--> 
<!--End center content area-->

			by <span>Shanaz Begum</span>
			</p>
		</div>
	
    
    

<!--End last modified info-->

		<hr />
		
<p class="lead">*NOTE: All scholarship and student funding schemes are subject to availability of funds, and details given here are subject to change at any time. Potential applicants are urged to check information regularly to ensure they are aware of current procedures, deadlines etc.</p>

<!-- start main slot where silva content gets rendered--> 
	<h2 class="heading">Scholarships and Funding</h2>

<h3 class="heading">Philosophy</h3>





<table class="silvatable table" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="100%" class="align-center" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-center">
  <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships/faq/" target="_self">Important information for Students</a>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>


<h4 class="heading">Philosophy MPhil/PhD Research Scholarships</h4>








<h6 class="heading">AJ Ayer Scholarship in Philosophy </h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: Up to £3,500</p>




<h6 class="heading">AJ Ayer-Sumitomo Corporation Scholarship in Philosophy </h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: Up to £800</p>




<h6 class="heading">Dawes Hicks Postgraduate Scholarships in Philosophy </h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: Up to £5,000</p>




<h6 class="heading">Downing Postgraduate Scholarship in Philosophy </h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: Up to £250</p>




<h6 class="heading">Follett Scholarship</h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: Up to £13,000</p>




<h6 class="heading">Jacobsen Scholarship in Philosophy</h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: Up to £9,500</p>




<h6 class="heading">Keeling Scholarship</h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: UK/EU tuition fees plus a bursary</p>




<h6 class="heading">John Stuart Mill Scholarship in Philosophy of Mind and Logic</h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: Up to £1,400</p>




<h6 class="heading">The George Melhuish Postgraduate Scholarships </h6>


<p class="p"><strong>Value</strong>: Up to £3,700</p>



<h5 class="heading">Deadline</h5>



<p class="p">n/a</p>



<h5 class="heading">Application and Information</h5>



<p class="p">No separate application is required for the above scholarships. All who are admitted to research programmes in Philosophy will be invited to apply, and decisions regarding these awards will be made in September. </p>
<p class="p">Queries should be directed to: <br /></p>
<p class="p">Dr. Fiona Leigh: <a href="mailto:fiona.leigh@ucl.ac.uk">fiona.leigh@ucl.ac.uk</a></p>
<p class="p">Telephone +44 (0)20 7679 3074</p>


<!-- end main slot where silva content gets rendered--> 
<!--End center content area-->

<p class="lead">*NOTE: All scholarship and student funding schemes are subject to availability of funds, and details given here are subject to change at any time. Potential applicants are urged to check information regularly to ensure they are aware of current procedures, deadlines etc.</p>

                                  <div class="info">
                                    <h2 class="heading">The resource cannot be found</h2>
                                    <p class="p">
                                      <acronym title="Uniform Resource Locator">URL</acronym>:
                                      http://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/philosophy/current-students/ba-programmes/ba-courses
                                      <br /><br />
                                    </p>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      Most likely causes:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>There might be a typing error in the address.</li>
                                          <li>If you clicked on a link, it may be out of date.</li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      What you can try:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>Retype the address.</li>
                                          <li>Use the search box above to find what you're looking for.</li>
                                          <li>Go to <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk" title="UCL Website">www.ucl.ac.uk</a> and look for the information you want.</li>
                                          <li><a href="javascript:history.back()" title="Back to previous page">Go back to the previous page.</a></li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      More information:
                                    </h4>
                                    <p class="p">
                                        This error (<acronym title="Hypertext Transfer Protocol">HTTP</acronym> 404 Not Found) means that you have connected to the UCL Website, but the page you wanted was not found. It's possible that the webpage is temporarily unavailable. Alternatively, the UCL Website might have changed or removed the webpage. 
                                    </p>
                                  </div>

                                      Most likely causes:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>There might be a typing error in the address.</li>
                                          <li>If you clicked on a link, it may be out of date.</li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      What you can try:
                                    </h4>

                                      </ul>

                                      More information:
                                    </h4>
                                    <p class="p">

It's possible that the webpage is temporarily unavailable. Alternatively, the UCL Website might have changed or removed the webpage.

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Coursework Penalties</h1>
<p class="p"><strong>Lateness penalties for Undergraduate and Postgraduate (Taught) essays:</strong></p>
<p class="p">Planning, time-management and the meeting of deadlines are
part of the personal and professional skills expected of all graduates. For
this reason, UCL expects students to submit all coursework by the published
deadline date and time, after which penalties will be applied.</p>
<p class="p">If a student experiences something which prevents them from
meeting a deadline that is sudden, unexpected, significantly disruptive and
beyond their control, they should submit an Extenuating Circumstances (EC) Form.
If the request is accepted, the student may be granted an extension. If the
deadline has already passed, the late submission may be condoned i.e. there
will be no penalty for submitting late.</p>
<p class="p">Further information:</p>




<h5 class="heading"></h5>


<p class="p">· <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/srs/academic-manual/c4/module-assessment#3.11" target="_blank">Late Submission Penalties</a></p>
<p class="p">· <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/srs/academic-manual/extenuating-circumstances">Extenuating Circumstances</a></p>
<p class="p"><strong><br />Penalties for over-length coursework, including dissertations:</strong> <br /></p>
<p class="p">Assessed work should not exceed the prescribed word count. </p>
<p class="p">References and footnotes count towards the word limit; the bibliography, title and cover sheet do not.</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li>For work that exceeds a specified maximum length by less than 10% the mark will be reduced by five percentage marks, but the penalised mark will not be reduced below the pass mark, assuming the work merited a Pass.</li>
<li>For work that exceeds a specified maximum length by 10% or more the mark will be reduced by ten percentage marks, but the penalised mark will not be reduced below the pass mark, assuming the work merited a Pass.</li>
</ul>
<p class="p"><strong><br />Minimum Length</strong></p>
<p class="p">Please note there is no automatic penalty for under-length essays <strong>providing there is sufficient suitable content</strong>.</p>
<p class="p"><strong><br />Reuse of material</strong></p>
<p class="p">Any paper submitted by you is presumed to be original work that has not previously been submitted for another course. You should therefore, as a rule, avoid writing on topics that you have written on previously. If you consider that there is good reason for you to revisit a topic, or to overlap with previously submitted work, then you must consult, and obtain prior written approval from the course tutor. If permission is granted, the onus will nevertheless remain on you to avoid mere duplication.<br /></p>
<p class="p"><strong><br />Plagiarism</strong></p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/current-students/guidelines/plagiarism" target="_self">Read UCL central information on plagiarism</a></li>
</ul>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-link"></i> 
  <h2 class="heading">Quick Links</h2>
<ul class="disc">

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">S.V. Keeling Memorial Lecture</h1>
<p class="p"><abbr title="Keeling Lecture"></abbr>Together with the UCL Greek and Latin, and through the generosity of a private donor, the UCL Philosophy department organises an annual S.V. Keeling Memorial Lecture in Ancient Philosophy.  </p>
<p class="p">The Keeling Centre are pleased to announce that in the Autumn of 2017, a <strong>supplementary lecture</strong> will be given by <strong>Professor Dorothea Frede </strong>(University of Hamburg, Humboldt University) and will be entitled '<a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/lectures/SuppLectPoter" target="_self"><strong>Aristotle on the Importance of Laws, Rules and Institutions</strong></a>'. </p>


<h3 class="heading">2017 Supplementary Lecture</h3>




<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>
<table class="silvatable list" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  <p class="p"><strong>19 October 2017</strong></p>
<p class="p">5pm-7pm<br /><br /></p>

</td>
<td class="align-left">
  <p class="p"><strong>Location:</strong></p>
<p class="p">Lecture Theatre D103<br />25 Gordon St, UCL <br />London WC1H 0AY<br /></p>

</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>


<h3 class="heading"></h3>




<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="30%" class="align-left" />
<col width="70%" class="align-left" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  <img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/images/ProfFrede" width="1280" height="960" alt="Prof Frede" class="medium-image" title="Prof Frede" />
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  

<h3 class="heading">Professor Dorothea Frede</h3>




<p class="p">Dorothea Frede is Professor Emeritus at the University of Hamburg and Honorary Professor at the Humboldt University at Berlin. Since 2006 she has been the Mills Adjunct Professor of Philosophy at UC Berkeley. </p>
<p class="p">Prof Frede has published widely on a number of topics within Ancient Philosophy, with a particular focus on Aristotle, Plato and Hellenistic philosophy. She has also published on the work of Martin Heidegger. </p>
<p class="p"> </p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.philosophie.uni-hamburg.de/philosophisches-seminar/personen/frede-dorothea.html" target="_blank">Learn more about Prof Frede.</a></li>
</ul>

</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>


<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>




<hr class="rule" />
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>
<p class="p">In addition to the lecture, Professor Frede will be running a Graduate Masterclass on Wednesday 18th October for students of the University of London. For inquiries please contact Margaret Hampson (margaret.hampson.09@ucl.ac.uk).</p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

    class="navitem">Events at the Keeling Centre</a></li>
                    
                
            
        </ul>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">S. V. Keeling Memorial Lecture (2016)</h1>
<p class="p">Together with the UCL Greek and Latin, and through the generosity of a private donor, the UCL Philosophy department organises an annual S.V. Keeling Memorial Lecture in Ancient Philosophy.  The 2015-2016 lecture was given by <strong>Professor Susanne Bobzien</strong> (All Souls, Oxford) and was entitled '<strong>Did Frege plagiarize the Stoics?</strong>'</p>


<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>




<p class="p">Prof. Bobzien also ran a Graduate Masterclass on Tuesday 15th March, attended by Graduate Students from UCL, KCL and Royal Holloway University. </p>
<hr class="rule" />
<table class="silvatable list" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  

<h3 class="heading">2016 Lecture</h3>





</td>
<td class="align-left">
  &nbsp;
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td class="align-left">
  <strong>When: 18th March 2016</strong><br />
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  <strong>Where:</strong><br />Gustave Tuck Lecture Theatre<br />Wilkins Building, UCL <br />Gower Street, London WC1E 6BT<br /><a href="http://crf.casa.ucl.ac.uk/screenRoute.aspx?s=386&amp;d=186&amp;w=False" target="_self"><strong>How to get there</strong></a><br />
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="30%" class="align-left" />
<col width="70%" class="align-left" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  <img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/lectures/susan-bobzien" width="200" height="217" alt="susan-bobzien" class="medium-image" title="susan-bobzien" />
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  

<h3 class="heading">Professor Susanne Bobzien </h3>




<p class="p">Susanne Bobzien is professor of philosophy and Senior Research Scholar at All Souls College, Oxford. Before joining Oxford, Professor Bobzien was at Yale University (2002 to 2013). Her research interest include ancient logic and ancient theories of determinism and freedom. She is author of <em>Determinism and Freedom in Stoic Philosophy.</em></p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.asc.ox.ac.uk/person/2155" target="_self">Learn more about Prof. Bobzien</a></li>
</ul>

</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr class="rule" />
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<tbody>

			                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/colloquia"
                      class="navitem">Keeling Colloquium</a>
                            
                        </li>
                    
                    
                        <li>
                        
			                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/Ancient_Greek_Philosophy_Reading_Group"
                      class="navitem">UCL-KCL Ancient Greek Philosophy Reading Group</a>
                            
                        </li>
                    
                    
                        <li>
                        
			                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/history"
                      class="navitem">History</a>
                            
                        </li>
                    
                    
                        <li>
                        
			                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/documents"
                      class="navitem">Contact Us</a>
                            
                        </li>
                    
                    
                        <li>
                        
			                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/Events"
                      class="navitem">Events at the Keeling Centre</a>
                            
                        </li>
                    
                
            </ul>
        </nav>
    </div> <!-- end #sidebar -->

                        <li>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">S.V. Keeling Memorial Lecture (2014)</h1>
<p class="p">Together with the UCL Greek and Latin, and through the generosity of a private donor, the UCL Philosophy department organises an annual S.V. Keeling Memorial Lecture in Ancient Philosophy. The lecture in 2014 was given by <strong>Prof. Gail Fine</strong> and was entitled '<strong>Knowledge, Belief and Perception in the <em>Phaedo</em></strong>'</p>
<hr class="rule" />


<h3 class="heading">2014 Lecture</h3>




<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>
<table class="silvatable list" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  <p class="p"><strong>Held on: </strong></p>
<p class="p"><strong>12 March 2014</strong><br />4pm-6pm<br /><br /></p>

</td>
<td class="align-left">
  <p class="p"><strong>Held at:</strong></p>
<p class="p">Gustave Tuck Lecture Theatre <br />Wilkins Building, UCL <br />Gower Street, London WC1E 6BT<br /></p>

</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"> </h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>







<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading">S.V. Keeling Masterclass: 11 March 2014 </h3>




<p class="p"><strong>Knowledge and Belief in <em>Republic</em> 5 </strong></p>
<p class="p">Professor Fine also ran a Masterclass for Graduate students entitled 'Knowledge and Belief in <em>Republic</em> 5.', held at the Department of Philosophy on 11 March 2014.</p>


<h3 class="heading"> Prof. Gail Fine</h3>




<img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/lectures/Gfine" width="200" height="154" alt="Gfine" class="medium-image float-left" title="Gfine" /><p class="p">Prof. Fine is visiting Professor of Ancient Philosophy at Merton College, Oxford. Her books include:</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><em>On Ideas: Aristotle’s Criticism of Plato’s Theory of Forms</em> (OUP, 1993)
</li>
<li><em>Plato on Knowledge and Forms: Selected Essays</em> (OUP, 2003)</li>
<li><em>The Possibility of Inquiry: Meno’s Paradox from Socrates to Sextus</em> (OUP, 2014).</li>
</ul>
<hr class="rule" />

<h2 class="heading"></h2>







<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>




<p class="p"><strong></strong></p>

<h2 class="heading"> </h2>

<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>
<table class="silvatable list" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">S.V. Keeling Memorial Lecture (2015)</h1>
<p class="p"><abbr title="Keeling Lecture"></abbr>Together with the UCL Greek and Latin, and through the generosity of a private donor, the UCL Philosophy department organises an annual S.V. Keeling Memorial Lecture in Ancient Philosophy.  The 2014-2015 lecture was given by <strong>Professor David Sedley </strong>and was entitled<strong> 'Socrates' Second Voyage (Plato, <em>Phaedo, </em>99-101)'</strong></p>
<hr class="rule" />
<p class="p"><strong><br /></strong></p>


<h3 class="heading">2015 Lecture</h3>




<table class="silvatable list" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  <p class="p"><strong>Held: 13 May 2015</strong><br />5pm-7pm<strong><br /></strong></p>
<p class="p">With a prior reception held in the JZ Young Lecture Theater Foyer</p>

</td>
<td class="align-left">
  <strong>Held at:</strong><br />JZ Young Lecture Theatre in the Anatomy Building.<strong><br /></strong>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p class="p"><strong><br /></strong></p>


<h3 class="heading">S.V.Keeling Masterclass: 12 May 2015</h3>




<p class="p">Associated with the lecture was a Masterclass for Graduate students led by Prof. Sedley on 12 May 2015. </p>


<h3 class="heading">Professor David Sedley</h3>




<div class="medium-image      image-left"><img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/lectures/David_Sedley" width="200" height="133" alt="david sedley" class="medium-image      image-left" title="david sedley" /></div><p class="p">Prof. Sedley is Laurence Professor of Ancient Philosophy Fellow of Christ's College, Cambridge. </p>
<p class="p">His books include: </p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><em>The Hellenistic Philosophers</em> (with <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A._A._Long">A. A. Long</a>), Cambridge 1987</li>
<li><em>Lucretius and the Transformation of Greek Wisdom</em>, Cambridge 1998</li>
<li><em>The Cambridge Companion to Greek and Roman Philosophy</em>, Cambridge 2003</li>
<li><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plato"><em>Plato's</em></a> <em><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cratylus">Cratylus</a></em>, Cambridge 2003</li>
<li><em>The Midwife of Platonism. Text and Subtext in Plato's</em> <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theaetetus_(dialogue)"><em>Theaetetus</em></a>, Oxford 2004</li>
<li><em>Creationism and its Critics in Antiquity</em>, Berkeley and Los Angeles 2007</li>
<li><em>Pyrrhonists, Patricians, Platonizers. Hellenistic Philosophy in the Period 155-86 BC</em> (edited with A. M. Ioppolo), Naples, 2007</li>
</ul>


<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>




<br><br>


<h3 class="heading"><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/lectures/Keeling_Lecture">Official Poster for S.V.Keeling Lecture and Masterclass 2014</a></h3>





<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>

            Modernizr.load({
                //cutting the mustard as used by the BBC
                test : cuttingTheMustard
                //if old browser load the shiv
                ,nope : [
                    '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/html5shiv-printshiv.min.js'

                ]
            });
            //set conditional assets for main.js

                pathToJquery: '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/jquery-1.9.1.min'

            }
            if(cuttingTheMustard){
                globalSiteSpecificVars.pathToJquery = '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/jquery-2.1.1.min';
            }
        </script>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Past Lectures</h1>
<p class="p">Most of the first ten lectures have been published in <em>Modern Thinkers and Ancient Thinkers</em>, edited by R. W. Sharples (London: UCL Press, 1993). Most of the second ten lectures have been published in <em>Perspectives on Greek Philosophy</em>, edited by R. W. Sharples (Aldershot: Ashgate, 2003). Below you will find a list of all previous Keeling lectures.</p>
<hr class="rule" />
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>

</tbody>
</table>
<table class="silvatable list" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="33%" class="align-left" />
<col width="66%" class="align-left" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  
<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading">2016</h2>






</td>
<td class="align-left">
  &nbsp;
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td class="align-left">
   18 March 2016<br /><br />
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/keeling/lectures/2016lecture">Prof. Susanne Bobzien - Did Frege Plagarize the Stoics?</a>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="odd">

</td>
</tr>

<table class="silvatable list" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="100%" class="align-left" />

<td colspan="1">
  Previous Keeling lecturers

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Prospective Students</h1>
<p class="p">All major areas of philosophy are available for study at UCL, covering branches such as political thought, epistemology and metaphysics, and also drawing upon the writings of philosophers both ancient and modern to place your studies in context.</p>
<!-- Subtemplate: 3 columns with 33/33/33 divisions -->  
<section class="threecolumns">
  
  <section class="threecolumns__column1"> 
    
<p class="clearfix">
 <a href="/philosophy/prospective-students/undergraduate"
    class="cta btn pull-left"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','CTA','Click','/philosophy/prospective-students/undergraduate'])">

   Undergraduate

 </a>
</p>

<h2 class="heading"></h2>





<p class="p"><strong></strong></p>


  </section> 

<section class="threecolumns__column2"> 
    
<p class="clearfix">
 <a href="/philosophy/prospective-students/graduate-taught"
    class="cta btn pull-left"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','CTA','Click','/philosophy/prospective-students/graduate-taught'])">

   Graduate (Taught)

 </a>
</p>
<p class="p"><br /><strong></strong></p>


  </section> 
 
 <section class="threecolumns__column3"> 
    
<p class="clearfix">
 <a href="/philosophy/prospective-students/graduate-research"
    class="cta btn pull-left"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','CTA','Click','/philosophy/prospective-students/graduate-research'])">

   Graduate (Research)

 </a>
</p>

<h2 class="heading"></h2>





<p class="p"><strong></strong></p>


  </section> 

</section> 

<!-- Subtemplate: 3 columns with 33/33/33 divisions -->  
<section class="threecolumns">
  
  <section class="threecolumns__column1"> 
    
<p class="clearfix">
 <a href="/philosophy/prospective-students/why-ucl-philosophy"
    class="cta btn pull-left"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','CTA','Click','/philosophy/prospective-students/why-ucl-philosophy'])">

   Why UCL Philosophy?

 </a>
</p>

<h2 class="heading"></h2>





<p class="p"><strong></strong></p>


  </section> 

<section class="threecolumns__column2"> 
    
<p class="clearfix">
 <a href="/philosophy/prospective-students/study-abroad-at-ucl"
    class="cta btn pull-left"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','CTA','Click','/philosophy/prospective-students/study-abroad-at-ucl'])">

   Study Abroad at UCL

 </a>
</p>
<p class="p"><br /><strong></strong></p>


  </section>

   Careers &amp; Destinations

 </a>
</p>

<h2 class="heading"></h2>





<p class="p"><strong></strong></p>


  </section>

<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--None">
  
  <i class="fa None"></i> 
  <h2 class="heading">UCL+</h2>
<ul class="disc">
<li>Register interest in your chosen subjects</li>
<li>Request a printed prospectus</li>
<li>Receive notice of undergraduate open days, events and more</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/ucl-plus" target="_self">Sign Up ...&gt;&gt;</a></li>
</ul>


</section>

</div>

<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/fees-funding" target="_self">Undergraduate</a></li>

</ul>


</section>

<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--None">
  
  <i class="fa None"></i> 
  <h2 class="heading">Accommodation</h2>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/accommodation" target="_self">Student accommodation</a></li>

</ul>


</section>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Careers &amp; Destinations</h1>

<h2 class="heading">Resources at UCL</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/careers" target="_self">Careers</a></li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">Beyond UCL</h2>





<p class="p">UCL Philosophy graduates often go on to undertake careers in law, computing, academia, public administration, publishing,
and writing or journalism. <br /></p>
<p class="p">It is notable that many of our graduates work for
publicly funded bodies, and many others in relatively small organisations. Others have joined the police, started
their own business, or undertaken further study.</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/careers/departments/careers_with_a_philosophy_degree" target="_self">Learn more about careers with a Philosophy degree</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/alumni/phd-placement-record" target="_self">See our full PhD placement record</a></li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">Selected Destinations</h2>





<table class="silvatable silvatable list" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />
<col width="50%" class="align-left" />

<td class="align-left">

</td>

<h2 class="heading">Alumni in the Public Eye</h2>





<a class="image" href="http://www.rickygervais.com/" title="Ricky Gervais" target="_blank"><img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/images/RickyGervais.png" width="143" height="182" alt="Ricky Gervais" class="no-respond float-left" title="Ricky Gervais" /></a><p class="p"><a href="http://www.rickygervais.com/" target="_self">Ricky Gervais</a>  (Philosophy BA, 1983)</p>
<p class="p">Comedian, actor, director, producer, musician, writer, and former radio presenter. He received widespread success and critical acclaim with the TV series 'The Office' and has since gone one to appear in Hollywood movies including 'Cemetry Junction', 'Ghost Town' and 'The Invention of Lying'.</p>
<hr class="rule" />
<a class="image" href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b006qgvj/presenters/jonathan-dimbleby" title="Jonathan Dimbleby" target="_blank"><img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/images/Jonathan_Dimbleby.png" width="143" height="182" alt="Jonathan Dimbleby" class="no-respond float-left" title="Jonathan Dimbleby" /></a><p class="p"><a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b006qgvj/presenters/jonathan-dimbleby" target="_self">Johnathan Dimbleby</a> (Philosophy BA, 1969)</p>
<p class="p">Chair of BBC Radio 4's Any Questions? since 1987, Johnathan Dimbleby is also a past President of the Soil Association and CPRE. He is currently President of the VSO (since 1997) and chairman of Index on Censorship (since 2008). He is also a trustee of Dimbleby Cancer Care.<br /></p>
<hr class="rule" />
<a class="image" href="http://www.petercave.com/" title="Peter Cave" target="_blank"><img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/images/Peter_Cave.png" width="143" height="182" alt="Peter Cave" class="no-respond float-left" title="Peter Cave" /></a><p class="p"><a href="http://www.petercave.com/" target="_self">Peter Cave</a><strong> </strong>(Philosophy BA, 1972)</p>
<p class="p">Author of a number of books including 'This Sentence is False', 'Can A Robot Be Human?', 'What's Wrong With Eating People?', 'Humanism: A Beginner's Guide', 'Do Llamas Fall in Love?' and 'Philosophy'. He has also appeared on BBC Radio 4.</p>
<hr class="rule" />
<a class="image" href="http://ken-follett.com/" title="Ken Follett" target="_blank"><img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/images/Ken_Follett.png" width="143" height="182" alt="Ken Follett" class="no-respond float-left" title="Ken Follett" /></a><p class="p"><a href="http://ken-follett.com/" target="_self">Ken Follett</a><strong> </strong>(Philosophy BA, 1970)</p>
<p class="p">Author Ken Follett has sold over 100 million copies of his books worldwide. Four of his works have reached the number one spot on the New York Times best-seller list - 'The Key to Rebecca', 'Lie Down with Lions', 'Triple' and 'World Without End'.</p>
<hr class="rule" />
<a class="image" href="http://www.noreena.com/" title="Noreena Hertz" target="_blank"><img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/images/Noreena_Hertz.png" width="143" height="182" alt="Noreena Hertz" class="no-respond float-left" title="Noreena Hertz" /></a><p class="p"><a href="http://www.noreena.com/" target="_self">Noreena Hertz</a><strong> </strong>(Philosophy &amp; Economics BA, 1987)<br />An economist, author and campaigner, Noreena Hertz has previously been listed as one of the Guardian's Top 101 Female Public Intellectuals. Her 2002 book 'The Silent Takeover' famously warned that unregulated markets, corporate greed, and over-powerful financial institutions would have serious global consequences.</p>
<hr class="rule" />
<a class="image" href="http://shahrarali.net/" title="Sharar Ali" target="_blank"><img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/images/Shahrar_Ali.png" width="143" height="182" alt="Sharar Ali" class="no-respond float-left" title="Sharar Ali" /></a><p class="p"><a href="http://shahrarali.net/" target="_self">Shahrar Ali</a><strong> </strong>(PhD, 2004) </p>
<p class="p">Now working in green politics, Dr Shahrar Ali has formerly worked as a researcher in the European Parliament on the risks of GM food. He is an officer of London Green Party. His PhD focused on examining lying and deception, with specific reference to public life.</p>

<h2 class="heading">Other Notable Alumni</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li> <a href="http://www.dhkerby.com/" target="_self">D H Kerby</a> (Study Abroad at UCL Student, 1985)</li>
<li> <a href="http://www.microphilosophy.net/" target="_self">Julian Baggini</a> (PhD, 1996)</li>
<li> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dimitris_Lyacos" target="_self">Dimitris Lyacos</a> (Philosophy MA, 1993)</li>
<li> <a href="http://www.dianajanney.com/" target="_self">Diana Janney </a>(Philosophy BA - 1991, MA - 1992)</li>
<li> <a href="http://www.philosophy-foundation.org/home" target="_self">Peter Worley </a>(Philosophy BA, 2000)</li>
</ul>
<p class="p"><strong><br /></strong> </p>
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<tbody>

</table>
